1 This document specifies the hexadecimal representation of the Chinese graphic characters and the binary code for information technology.
This document applies to the processing, exchange, storage, transmission, display, input and output of Chinese and other character information.

This document is applicable to technical products with Chinese and other character information processing and exchange functions, including but not limited to software products represented by input methods, optical character recognition (OCR), editing and proofreading, machine translation, speech synthesis, text transcription, and so on, as well as handy products represented by computers, communication terminals, e-book readers, and learning machines.
2 normative reference documents

For dated references, only the version dated in the reference applies to this document; for undated references, the latest edition (including all amendments) applies to this document.

3. Terms and definitions
The following definitions and abbreviations such apply in this document.
3.1 character
an element of a collection of elements used to organize, control, or represent data.
3.2 coded character
character (3.1) and its encoding are shown.
3.3 Private Use Area

3.4 repertoire

4.1 Overview
characters in this document are encoded as single bytes, double bytes, or four bytes.
The single-byte part includes all 128 characters from 0x00 to 0x7F in GB/T 11383-1989.
4.3 Two-byte Part
The double-byte part includes all graphic characters in GB/T 2312-1980, all CJK unified ideographs in GB/T 13000, and some graphic characters.
the characters of the double-byte part are in accordance with the provisions of Appendix A.
In particular, the graphic, code position and function of the ideographic character descriptor shall comply with the requirements of Appendix B.
Note: GB/T 13000 is a unified encoding for Chinese characters used in China, Japan, Korea, Vietnam, etc.

The Chinese characters with unique abstract forms are assigned with individual code positions, while the Chinese characters with the same abstract forms but different sources are assigned with shared code positions.
The encoded Chinese characters are called CJK Unified Ideographs, where CJK stands for China, Japan, and Korea.
4.4 Four-byte Part

The four-byte part includes 66 CJK unified ideographs (9FA6-9FEF, excluding 9FB4-9FBB) and the characters of the CJK unified ideograph extension A, CJK unified ideograph extension B, CJK unified ideograph extension C, CJK unified ideograph extension D, CJK unified ideograph extension E, and the characters of the ethnic minority languages that have been encoded in GB/T 13000.
the characters in the four-byte portion are determined in accordance with the provisions of appendix C.
5 Overall Structure of the System
In the text, any number preceded by 0x is represented in hexadecimal, and any number not preceded by 0x is represented in decimal.
hexadecimal notation is used to represent encoded values in the appendix, and decimal notation is used to represent other values.
The single-byte part adopts the encoding structure of GB/T 11383-1989, using the 0x00~0x7F code bits.
The double-byte character set is represented by two eight-bit binary bit strings, and the first byte code bit is from 0x81 to 0xFE, and the last byte code bit is from 0x40 to 0x7E and 0x80 to 0xFE.
The four-byte part uses 0x30-0x39, which are not used in GB/ISO 11383-1989, as the suffix for the double-byte encoding extension, and the encoding range is 0x81308130-0xFE39FE39.

The first byte of the four-byte character is encoded in the range of 0x81 to 0xFE; the second byte is encoded in the range of 0x30 to 0x39; the third byte is encoded in the range of 0x81 to 0xFE; the fourth byte is encoded in the range of 0x30 to 0x39. That is: 0x81308130 to 0x81308139; 0

9.1 General Provisions
this document defines three levels of implementation.
The system software product that meets the corresponding implementation level should provide the input and output function of all characters in the corresponding implementation level range.
9.2 Achieve Level 1

implement the single-byte encoding part, double-byte encoding part, and four-byte down encoding part of the CJK unified ideographs (i.e., 0x82358F33-0x82359636) and CJK unified ideographs extension A (i.e., 0x8139EE39-0x82358738) of level 1 text documents.
any product to which this document applies shall meet the requirements of level 1.
Note: according to the needs of software application, the level 1 can also choose any one or more of the non-Chinese scripts listed in the table 3.
9.3 Achieve level 2
Level 2 includes Level 1.
In addition, the level 2 realization also includes the characters in the List of General Standard Chinese Characters that are not included in the level 1 realization.
the code position and the form of the Chinese characters in the List of General Standard Chinese Characters are shown in the appendix.
system software and support software shall meet the requirements of level 2.

Note: system software and document support software include but are not limited to operating systems, database management systems, middleware (see information on software product classification in GB/T 36475).
9.4 Achieve level 3
Level 3 includes Level 2.
In addition, the level 3 achievement requires the use of all the characters in the document and the Kangxi radicals in Table 3.
products used for government services and public services should meet the requirements of level 3.

Note: the public service and shared service industries include but are not limited to railway transport, road transport, water transport, aviation transport, intermodal transport and transportation agency, postal and telecommunications, currency and financial services, insurance, land management, health, national institutions, social security, etc. (see GB/ 4754 for industry classification information).

Description (DESCRIPTION) C and C++ compilers are integrated. They both process input files in one or more of the four steps: preprocessing, compilation, assembly, and linking.
The extension on a source file identifies the language of the source file, but to the compiler, the extension controls the default settings:
gcc 认为预处理后的文件(.i) 是 c 文件,并且设定 c 形式的连接,
g++ 认为预处理后的文件 (.i) 是c++文件,并且设定c++形式的连接.
The source file postfix indicates the language type and the subsequent operation:
.c C source program; preprocessing, compilation, linking
.C C++ source program; preprocessing, compilation, linking
.cc C++ source program; preprocessing, compilation, linking
CXX C++ source program; preprocessing, compilation, linking
.m Objective-C source program; preprocessing, compilation, linking
.i preprocessed c file; compile, assemble
.ii preprocessed c++ file; compile, assemble
.s assembly language source program; assembler
assembly language source program; preprocessing, assembly
.h preprocessor file; files that are not normally seen on the command line are passed to the linker (Linker). Typically includes:
.0 Object file
.a archive file
unless the -cec, -s, or -E options are used (or a compile error prevents the full process), linking is the final step.

at link time, all the .e files, .o files, and .a files that correspond to the source program are passed to the linker options (OPTIONS) in the order specified on the command line, including any specified .h files and .a files that cannot be resolved.

-funsigned-char defines char as an unsigned type, just like unsigned char.
Each machine has its own default char type. It can be unsigned char or signed char.
In the ideal case, when the sign of the data is important, a portable program should always use signed char or unsigned char.

but many programs are already written using only simple char, and it is assumed that this is a symbolic number (or an unsigned number, depending on the target machine on which the program is to be executed).
this option, and its opposite, cause such programs to work with the corresponding default values.
the type of char should always be explicitly defined as signed char or unsigned char , even if it behaves exactly the same as one of them.
If the signed or unsigned qualifier is not explicitly specified, these options are used to define signed or unsigned bit fields.
By default, bit-fields are signed because they inherit their base integer type, such as int, which is signed. However, if the `-traditional' option is specified, bit-fields are always unsigned.
fwritable-strings stores string constants in the writable data segment, and treats them no differently.
This is to support some old programs that consider changing string constants to be a very bad idea, and the `-traditional' option has the same effect.
Executive Summary
Impact of COVID-19 on the drug market
its impact may be similar to that of the 2008 economic crisis
The global COVID-19 pandemic has plunged the world into an unprecedented crisis.

In many countries, this disease has overwhelmed health care institutions, bringing them close to collapse, and the restrictions that governments have imposed have caused severe dislocations in the real economy around the globe.
The impact of the pandemic on the drug market is unclear and difficult to predict, but it could be far-reaching.
Some producers may be forced to seek new ways to produce drugs as the restrictions on movement also restrict access to precursors and basic chemicals.
Drug traffickers may have to find new routes and methods as they are unable to cross borders due to travel restrictions.
patterns of drug use and provision may change , and the government 's capacity to respond may be impeded .
The changes brought about by the COVID-19 pandemic are unprecedented, but we can still learn some lessons from previous crises.
After the economic crisis in 2008, some drug addicts began to seek cheaper synthetic substances and switched to injecting drugs.
Meanwhile, governments around the world have been cutting budgets for drug treatment.

if governments respond to the current recession in the same way , interventions to prevent drug use and related risky behaviors and treatment services for substance use disorders may be severely affected .
In addition, the priority of interdiction and international cooperation may be reduced, making it easier for traffickers to operate.
Some countries have a large amount of narcotics smuggled through commercial flights. It is estimated that the direct impact of drug trafficking activities in these countries will be the greatest.

Methamphetamine and other synthetic drugs are often smuggled in carry-on bags or hidden in personal luggage, sometimes in large quantities. Because almost all commercial aviation is restricted, the supply of drugs via commercial air travel may be completely cut off.
Although the international postal supply chain has also been disrupted, the activities of trafficking using the dark web and parcel post may increase.
In the long run , economic recessions and related shutdown measures may disrupt drug markets .

as a result of rising unemployment and lack of opportunity , the poor and disadvantaged are more likely to use drugs in harmful ways , to develop drug dependence , and to turn to illicit drug activities , whether production or distribution .
Drug trafficking organizations may take advantage of this situation by providing services to vulnerable populations and recruiting new members to bolster their ranks.
As governments' capacity to respond declines, these changes may take root quickly and become a new reality for many communities.
expansion and complexity
That breaks down into 2.8% growth outside of North America and 0.7% in North America.
the growth pattern of population partly explains the expansion of the market
drug use has been increasing worldwide, both in absolute numbers and as a proportion of the overall population.

In 2009, it was estimated that there were 210 million drug users worldwide, accounting for 4.8% of the global population aged 15-64, while in 2018, it was estimated that there were 269 million drug users worldwide, accounting for 5.3% of the population aged 15-64.
In the past two decades, the growth rate of drug abuse in developing countries is far higher than that in developed countries.

This to some extent reflects the difference in overall population growth during this period, with developed countries at 7% and developing countries at 28%, but also reflects the fact that the younger population in developing countries grows faster.
Teenagers and young adults make up the largest percentage of drug users.
Between 2000 and 2018, the population in this age group in developing countries grew by 16%, while it declined by 10% in developed countries.
1 urbanization is a current and future driver of the drug market
Drug abuse is more prevalent in urban areas than in rural areas in both developed and developing countries.
The overall increase in drug use is partly due to the massive migration of people from rural to urban areas — more than half of the world’s population now lives in cities, compared with 34% in 1960.
Urbanization may be a key factor in the future dynamics of the drug market , especially in developing countries where urbanization trends are more pronounced .

increases in wealth are associated with increases in drug use , but the burden of disease is greatest among the poorest people worldwide . In developed countries , drug use is more prevalent than in developing countries .
Cocaine and other drugs are more closely linked to the world's wealthier regions.
similarly , within countries , higher rates of drug use are associated with higher socioeconomic status .
But the rate of conversion to drug addiction is higher among people with lower socioeconomic status .
data from a few countries suggest that harmful patterns of drug use are associated with low income as well as illness .
these patterns are less common in more affluent social strata .
The economic constraints of the global Covid-19 crisis are likely to exacerbate the risks faced by the most vulnerable groups, including drug users.

For example, changes in the labor market, such as rising unemployment, have historically been associated with increases in drug use, and this pandemic has forced millions of people around the world out of work.

COVID-19 may lead to further expansion of drug markets The COVID-19 pandemic may lead to more farmers increasing or engaging in illegal crop cultivation, or because of the reduced control capacity of the government departments, or because in the economic crisis, more people may have to take risks to engage in illegal activities.

The related restrictions on COVID-19 have led to a reduction in air and land traffic, and the smuggling of goods by sea may have increased as a result. The risk of interception at sea is low, and the amount of smuggling by sea is greater than that by air or land.
Recently, there have been reports that cocaine shipments are being transported directly from South America to Europe by sea.
WE IMPROVE the ability of people to deal with complexity.
The situation of non-international controlled substances is stable, but the new type of opioids with potential harm is increasing, and the drug market is becoming more and more complicated.
In addition to cannabis, cocaine and heroin, hundreds of synthetic drugs have been added to the list, many of which are not controlled internationally. Nonmedical use of drugs is also on the rise.
There are about 500 new psychoactive substances in the domestic market of member states every year.
currently , most of these are stimulants , followed by synthetic cannabinoid receptor agonists and a small number of opioids .
Although the overall number of new psychoactive substances has stabilized, the proportion has changed.
Of the total number of new psychoactive substances identified in 2014, only 2% were opioids, but this number rose to 9% by 2018.

many of the novel synthetic opioids are fentanyl analogs , and their potency and harm have been demonstrated , leading to overdose deaths in North America and elsewhere , although to a lesser extent .
In North America, fentanyl is used as an adulterant in heroin and other drugs , including cocaine and methamphetamine , and as a precursor for the manufacture of illicitly produced opioid drugs .

some evidence suggests that injection of new psychoactive substances is also occurring in Europe : a study of discarded syringes in six European cities found that many of the syringes contained substances that produce stimulant effects .
2the use of new psychoactive substances may become firmly entrenched in disadvantaged groups
single new psychoactive substance has rarely formed a large market.
But evidence from Europe suggests that synthetic cannabinoids are a serious problem among socially marginalised groups such as the homeless and prisoners.
22 countries reported the use of new psychoactive substances in prisons , with synthetic cannabinoids being identified as the main challenge in most of these countries .

the control of precursor chemicals forces drug manufacturers to innovate, and many of the chemicals used as precursors to synthesize amphetamine, methamphetamine and “ecstasy” have been placed under international control.

Drug traffickers and drug manufacturers have been looking for substitutes - not only less controlled substances, but also chemicals specifically designed to evade controls, so-called "special precursors".
restrictive measures aimed at preventing the spread of COVID-19 are likely to further squeeze the drug producers who rely on precursor chemicals.

evidence from Mexico suggests that this is already a reality : reports indicate that in March 2020, a shortage of methamphetamine precursors imported from East Asia led to price increases in both Mexico and the United States .
in a fast-moving market.
synthetic drugs are replacing opioids in Central Asia and the Russian Federation
the opiate markets in Central Asia and the Russian Federation appear to have changed between 2008 and 2018 .
the number of persons treated for opioid use disorder has declined by approximately 80 % , and the amount of opioids seized by the Russian Federation authorities has decreased by approximately 80 % .
but the stimulant market seems to be booming.
there is evidence that methamphetamine and various cathinones , including mephedrone and a @-@ pyrrolidinophenylpentanone , are now widely available on the Russian drug market .
Russian authorities reported that the number of secret laboratories manufacturing various illegal drugs has sharply increased recently, doubling in two years, reaching 152 laboratories in 2018.
Methamphetamine markets in Afghanistan and Iraq grow
as early as 2012 , surveys of personnel in hospitals , prisons , and other institutions revealed the importance of methamphetamine in Iraq .
crystalline methamphetamine has become a major drug of concern in addition to fenethylline and tramadol .
A 2015 study further confirmed these findings, with users saying that cannabis is harder to get than "cocaine" or methamphetamine.

Recently, the Iraqi authorities have discovered several methamphetamine processing sites, and the Bureau has expressed concern about the large importation of pseudoephedrine preparations, which are used as precursors in methamphetamine processing sites.
Methamphetamine production in Afghanistan appears to have started in 2014 .
Since then, seizures of methamphetamine have been steadily increasing .
However, the amount of cocaine seized in the first half of 2019 - 657 kg - was a sharp increase compared with the previous year.
Large quantities of crystallized methamphetamine have been seized in several countries and there has also been a significant increase in seizures of Ecstasy in the region.
policy changes and trends
the jurisdictions that have legalized the nonmedical use of marijuana have generally seen an increase in marijuana use
Canada, Uruguay and 11 states in the U.S. allow the production of cannabis products for non-medical use.
in most jurisdictions , cannabis use has increased since legalization , although similar trends have been observed in jurisdictions that have not legalized nonmedical use .

In the two states in the US that were the first to legalize cannabis, Colorado and Washington, the number of adults who use cannabis for non-medical purposes has increased, especially in the past month and those who use it daily or almost daily, which has exceeded the national average since 2012.
All indicators show that since 2011, cannabis use in Uruguay has increased, with a near doubling of use last month.
this suggests that the increase is primarily attributable to increased use of marijuana on a regular and frequent basis .
Short-term data from Canada also suggests that as the legal market expanded from 2018 to 2019, so did use.
However, 40% of cannabis users still obtain some products illegally in 2019.
Has cannabis legalization caused a global drop in cannabis herb seizures?
In 2018, global seizures of cannabis herb fell to the lowest level in 20 years, owing to a reduction in the quantity seized in North America, which fell by 84% over the past decade.

By contrast , the level of seizures in the rest of the world nearly doubled during the same period . The pattern of seizures suggests that policies aimed at liberalizing the cannabis market played a key role in the decline .

the regulation of new psychoactive substances appears to have had a restraining effect on the domestic market for new psychoactive substances , but it is still difficult to assess the effectiveness of this regulation .
countries with different regulatory regimes for new psychoactive substances show different prevalence of use of these substances .
in other countries , use of new psychoactive substances has decreased after domestic legislation .

the use of drugs for pain management and palliative care is available in high @-@ income countries but is not available in low @-@ and middle @-@ income countries , and the distribution of these drugs is uneven across regions .
In 2018, more than 90% of the drug‐class opioids available for medical use were in high‐income countries.
about 50% in North America , 40% in Europe , and 2% in Oceania .
These countries account for about 12% of the world's population .
It is estimated that the population of low- and middle-income countries accounts for 88% of the global population, but the consumption of opioid drugs is less than 10%.
obstacles to obtaining prescription opioids are associated with many factors , including legislation , culture , health care systems , and prescribing practices .
People who are poorer are more likely to have a substance use disorder. In 2018, an estimated 3.56 million people had a substance use disorder.

Poverty , limited education , and social marginalization may increase risk for substance use disorders and exacerbate their consequences . This has been demonstrated in high @-@ income countries , where adverse socioeconomic trajectories , not just a person 's status at a given point in time , are associated with risk for substance use disorders .

drug use disorders also deepen social and economic disadvantage , further increasing the risk of unemployment , poverty , and homelessness , thereby perpetuating the cycle of disadvantage . These outcomes may also be related to stigmatizing attitudes and consequences within the criminal justice system .

women , ethnic minorities , immigrants , sexual and gender minorities , people displaced by armed conflict or disaster , and people in rural settings may be disproportionately affected by substance use disorders or have difficulties accessing treatment services .

according to the disability @-@ adjusted life @-@ year ( DALY ) metric , which estimates the number of healthy life @-@ years lost because of disability and premature death , harmful drug use has had a greater social impact in the past decade .
between 2007 and 2018 , the global burden of disability @-@ adjusted life @-@ years attributable to drug use increased by 17 % .
the increase in years of life lost to liver cancer associated with untreated hepatitis C among people who inject drugs is particularly high , at 40 % .
the links between drug use and violence are complex and difficult to determine the causal relationships between the use of psychoactive substances and violence .
limited data from around the world suggest that intoxication may be an important factor in homicide .
but alcohol seems to have a bigger effect in violent incidents than drugs do .

although drug use may lead to crime , in some cases , this association can be partially attributed to multiple intervening factors , such as socioeconomic disadvantage and other types of adversity that are caused by individual risk , family environment , and peer influences .
The link between drug trafficking and violence is multifaceted.
If there is a stable criminal structure, including large-scale organized crime activities such as international drug trafficking, it is possible to carry out these activities without violence.

In the short term , the presence and extent of violence are more a function of changes that destabilize the balance of power among organized crime groups than of the amount of trafficking . These changes include the size of the illegal market , the death or incarceration of prominent criminals , and law enforcement actions that weaken one group relative to another .
View the latest trends
Drug use most commonly involves cannabis, opioids cause most harm
However, the most widely used drug globally continues to be cannabis, with an estimated 188 million people having used the drug in 2017.
By comparison , 58 million people used opioids in 2018 .
But the harms associated with opioids have been largely ignored because of their relatively small user base.

of the estimated 167,000 deaths in 2017 that were associated with drug use disorders , 66 % were attributable to these substances , and 50 % of the 21 million years of life lost to disability or premature death that were attributable to drug use were attributable to these substances .
the nonmedical use of synthetic opioids has exacerbated a public health crisis

In West Africa, Central Africa and North Africa, the opioid crisis is exacerbated by tramadol ; in North America, it is fentanyl . These two regions have little in common in terms of economic, demographic or general patterns of drug use , but both are struggling with an opioid crisis fueled by substances that are readily available and cheap to produce .
In North America, the use of fentanyl and other synthetic opioids has led to a 20 @-@ year increase in opioid overdose deaths .
of the 67,367 overdose deaths registered in the United States in 2018 , two thirds involved fentanyl .
Canada also reported similar results, but with lower numbers.
part of the reason fentanyl is involved in overdose deaths is that the potency of fentanyl in the illicit drug market is unpredictable .
the market for nonmedical use of tramadol has grown substantially in West Africa , Central Africa , and North Africa .
In that region, the number of patients treated with tramadol for the condition is increasing.
In 2017, the global seizure of tramadol increased significantly, reaching a peak of more than 125 tons.
But in 2018, global seizures fell to 32 tons after India passed a new law regulating tramadol.
The two regions are driven by the ease of manufacture and low production costs, as well as the lack of international regulation of tramadol and many fentanyl analogs and precursors.
The worsening of these two crises is due to the availability of these substances in both the pharmaceutical and illicit markets, making them more difficult to detect and prevent from abuse .
Increasing use of stimulants
The stimulant field is dominated by cocaine and methamphetamine, both of which are increasing in use in their main markets.
In 2018, about 19 million people used cocaine, because it is popular in North America and Western Europe.
Approximately 27 million people used amphetamines that year, with methamphetamine being the most commonly used amphetamine type in Southeast Asia and North America.
Based on the majority of indicators, the use of methamphetamine in these two regions has expanded over the past 20 years.
in some markets , cocaine and methamphetamine can coexist , sometimes as substitutes , and the use of one drug rises as the use of the other falls , or both rise and fall to meet the same demand .
COVID @-@ 19 increases risk for injection drug users
An estimated 11.3 million people inject drugs in 2018, and globally, 10% of all HIV infections are caused by injection drug use.
More than 1 million people who inject drugs have HIV and 5.5 million have Hepatitis C.
In 2017, about 585,000 people died from drug use, half of whom died from liver disease caused by hepatitis C, while most of the hepatitis C among injecting drug users remained untreated.
the opioid shortage caused by COVID @-@ 19 restrictions may lead users to substitute more readily available substances such as alcohol or benzodiazepines or to mix opioids with synthetic drugs .
as some users switch to injecting or more frequent injecting , there may be more harmful use patterns .

EU Summit Debates Refugee Policy, EU Officials: Reception Process Faces Bottlenecks-ChinaNews.com
EU summit dominated by conflicts over refugee policy, EU officials say reception process is blocked at every step

[Global Times correspondent in Belgium, Niurui Fei] According to the report of Agence France-Presse on February 10, at the latest EU summit on the same day, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said that EU leaders agreed to adopt stricter policies on illegal immigration to facilitate the deportation of illegal immigrants.
The move is a response to the growing problem of illegal immigration in Europe, where the core issue is that very few illegal immigrants are ever deported.
According to the summit document, the EU leaders called on the Commission to "immediately mobilize a large amount of EU funds" to strengthen the external border with infrastructure and surveillance.
However, the EU and its member states have been arguing over who should pay for the fences.
Von der Leyen has repeatedly said that EU funds will not pay for the costs.

But some diplomatic officials of the member states said that if the EU can share the part of the installation of cameras, observation towers and other facilities along the external border, it will save the national budget and speed up the construction process.

The Euractiv website said that EU officials admitted that there were bottlenecks in every step of the refugee reception process, and that the limited reception capacity and the overwhelmed immigration authorities of member states could not stop refugees from submitting "countless" asylum applications in all EU countries, and the EU's refugee reception system was in a state of "near permanent crisis".

According to the estimate of the European Commission, the Schengen countries of the European Union received more than 920,000 asylum applications last year, an increase of nearly 50% from the previous year.
At the same time, the EU recorded more than 330,000 illegal entries last year.

Against this background, the summit also reached an agreement on a "principle" that EU countries can return illegal immigrants to their home countries based on the court judgments of another member state.
In addition, the report said that the EU leaders also agreed to "increase the use of the concept of safe countries", which would pave the way for the EU to formulate a common list.
Source: @EduardKovacs @softpedia (author: Niurui Fei)
US Upgrades "Chip War" to Deal a Heavy Blow to Global Semiconductor Industry - chinanews.com

Recently, the US has escalated its “chip war” against China. First, the Netherlands and Japan agreed to start controlling the export of semiconductor manufacturing equipment to China under pressure from the US. Then, according to foreign media reports, the US government is considering cutting off all links between US suppliers and Huawei, prohibiting US suppliers from providing any products to Huawei; the Biden administration is also preparing to issue an executive order to limit US investment in sensitive Chinese industries... In the early days of

In recent years, the US has never stopped its efforts to suppress China's semiconductor development. On the one hand, it has targeted the Chinese semiconductor supply chain, and on the other hand, it has built a semiconductor industry chain alliance to "de-Chinese" the industry, in an attempt to completely "leave behind" China in the advanced semiconductor industry.

Whether it is to establish a "technical alliance" with South Korea or to establish a "quadruple alliance" of chips with South Korea, Japan and Taiwan, or to establish a "small circle" of semiconductor industry chain through the "four-party mechanism" of the United States, Japan, India and Australia and the "Indo-Pacific economic framework", the United States attempts to build a closed supply chain by introducing political, camp and weaponized means into the semiconductor industry, so
However, the US’s large-scale “chip war” against China is also “a thousand injured, self-damaged eight hundred”.

Recently, the US well-known chip manufacturing equipment supplier Applied Materials announced that it would dismiss 1,300 full-time employees and plan to dismiss 1,400 temporary employees in the next two quarters due to the latest round of export ban on chip manufacturing equipment to China.

Recently, the world's leading lithography machine manufacturer, ASML Holding Co., Netherlands, warned that the ban on exporting semiconductor manufacturing equipment to China may lead to an increase in semiconductor prices.

According to the US media analysis, after the US government implemented the bullying pressure on the Chinese chip and semiconductor industries, many US companies suffered greatly, including electronic design automation tool developers, chip designers, wafer manufacturing equipment producers, and chip manufacturers themselves.
The so-called suppression of China's advanced semiconductor industry by the United States has dragged the global semiconductor industry chain and supply chain down.
The semiconductor industry is a high-tech and knowledge-intensive industry, and has long formed a closely linked global semiconductor industry chain.

According to professional estimates, based on specialized division of labor, the entire production process of semiconductor products needs to cross national borders more than 70 times, and the whole process takes 100 days.
Although the US semiconductor industry has a strong foundation, it is relatively weak in manufacturing capabilities, especially in advanced process technology, and is heavily dependent on East Asia.

Even if the United States vigorously guides the advanced chip supply chain to turn to the "small circle" regional development dominated by the United States, it is difficult to change the regional distribution and interdependence of the global semiconductor related industries.
The U.S. is vigorously "restructuring" and "de-Chinizing" the semiconductor industry chain, which has seriously damaged the global semiconductor industry.
Chips are the core of the future global industry, and the development of the chip industry cannot be separated from the participation of all countries in the world.

In recent years, the United States has taken a series of unilateral actions, successively issuing the Innovation and Competition Act, the 2022 U.S. Competition Act, and the Chip and Science Act, using its technological hegemony to consolidate its technological leadership; and using both sticks and carrots to coerce Intel, TSMC, Samsung, and other chip manufacturers to set up factories in the United States, and is doing its utmost to ensure the United States’ global leadership in the
In the short term, the US has indeed caused trouble for China’s semiconductor industry and related industries, and reaped real benefits.

However, in the long run, the US’s hysterical suppression will force China’s chip industry to make breakthroughs, and will make the US lose a huge Chinese market. Ultimately, it will greatly weaken the innovation will and innovation ability of US technology enterprises, and harm the development of the global chip industry.

First batch of individual pension fund financial products go on sale. The minimum duration is 60 days, maximum duration is 360 days-ChinaNews.com
First batch of individual pension fund investment products on sale
Seven products of the home institution can be selected. The minimum duration is 60 days, maximum duration is 360 days.
Personal pension fund financial products are finally online.

On February 10, the China Finance Network released the first batch of personal pension fund management products, and the seven personal pension fund management products of Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, Agricultural Bank of China and China Post Finance were officially launched.

At this point, the “shelf” of personal pension accounts has finally gathered four types of products, including personal pension savings, personal pension financial management, personal pension insurance, and personal pension public fund.

It is reported that the first batch of individual pension fund financial products are all open-ended net asset value products of public offerings. There are 5 new products and 2 continuing products. Except for one mixed product, the rest 6 products are fixed-income products.

The reporter of Beijing Youth Daily saw that 4 out of 5 newly issued products came from Industrial and Commercial Bank of China Wealth Management, and all of them were fixed-income products. The shortest holding period was 365 days, 540 days, 720 days and 1080 days, and the corresponding performance comparison benchmarks (annualized) were 3.70% - 4.20%, 4.10% - 4.60%, 4.40% -

The remaining new issue product is "Bank and Post Wealth Add Yin Hongjing Shortest Holding 1095 days No. 1", which is also a fixed income product. It started to collect funds on February 10 and ended on February 19. The risk level is level 2.

Among the two surviving products, one is the Agricultural Bank of China financial product "Agricultural Bank of China Unity and Agility" 360-day technology innovation RMB financial product, with an investment nature of mixed type and risk level of level three.

Another surviving product is "Bank and Post Wealth Add Yin Hongjing Shortest Holding 365 Days 1 Number", fixed income type, which began to collect in December 30 last year, and officially operated on January 4 this year. The accumulated net value on February 8 was 1.0011.

According to the "Opinions of the General Office of the State Council on Promoting the Development of Individual Pension Funds", the financial products that the pension fund account can invest in include bank wealth management, savings deposits, commercial pension insurance, and public funds.

The first individual retirement fund financial products are sold, which means that individual retirement fund investors can officially purchase financial products through individual retirement fund capital accounts.

In November last year, the China Banking and Insurance Regulatory Commission issued the "Interim Measures for the Management of Individual Pension Business of Commercial Banks and Wealth Management Companies".

The Regulation stipulates that participants can purchase personal pension savings, personal pension financial products, personal pension insurance products, and personal pension public fund products through the personal pension fund account.

Subsequently, the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security, the Ministry of Finance and the State Administration of Taxation issued a notice to clarify that the individual pension system will be implemented in 36 pilot cities and regions, including Beijing, Tianjin, Shijiazhuang, Xiong’an New Area, Jincheng, Shanxi Province, and so on.

As of the end of 2022, the number of participants in individual pension insurance was 19.54 million, the number of contributors was 6.13 million, and the total contribution amount was RMB14.2 billion.
Previously, the banks participating in the pilot program only listed three types of products: personal pension savings, personal pension insurance products, and personal pension public fund products.
Now that the personal pension fund investment products have been gathered, how should investors choose?

The expert of the Research and Development Department of the China Construction Bank Wealth Management said that compared with other personal pension products, the pension wealth management products and personal pension wealth management products in the pilot phase have three characteristics.
Firstly, the stability, the risk management mechanism is more perfect, the investment strategy and ideas are more stable, and the non-mother bank third-party independent custody is implemented.

Secondly, it is long-term. The term of pension financial products in the trial stage is more than 5 years, and the next step of the issued individual pension financial products, the minimum holding period is 1 year, and it is encouraged to hold for more than 3 years.

Third, it is inclusive, with low product purchase thresholds, generally starting at 1 yuan, and some as low as 0.01 yuan, and the product custody fee, management fee, and other fees are even more favorable.
Professional people pointed out that investors should choose according to the characteristics of the product and their own risk tolerance.

Personal pension savings have the characteristics of long-term, high interest rate and high safety, which is suitable for people with weak risk tolerance; personal pension insurance products focus on guarantee, which is more suitable for people who cannot bear investment risks and can accept stable income; while personal pension financial products and public fund products do not guarantee capital and income, but have certain investment risks, but the expected return is high, which is suitable for people with certain financial knowledge and high risk tolerance.

The fitness industry should get rid of the credibility crisis-China News Network
又一大型健身房“暴雷”?
Recently, the issue of the rights of members of the well-known fitness institution Zhongjian Fitness has attracted social attention.

After the Spring Festival, many members found that their stores were not operating normally. Then, the rumors of the collapse and running away of the institution caused panic among the members, which led to the intervention of the public security and human resources departments.
Finally, the relevant person in charge of the institution responded and promised to make efforts to protect the legitimate rights and interests of the employees and members, and the storm subsided.

Some branches of some fitness institutions have encountered problems in operation and temporarily closed. Consumers can wait calmly for the problem to be solved. Why did some members’ first reaction be “something is wrong”?
Behind the controversy of the rights of members of fitness clubs is a deep-rooted problem of trust crisis in the industry.
Traditional domestic gyms generally adopt the pre-payment model, and “making money from users who don’t come” is the bottom line of their development.

Through the pre-sale of membership cards to obtain cash flow, and continuously open new stores, it seems to be able to circulate, but in fact it is eating the seed corn, and cannot form a stable profit model.
The negative information about the health club running away and other industries frequently hit the headlines, which caused a strong impact on the consumer confidence.
From the perspective of market prospects, gyms are undoubtedly a good business with a bright future.
Although the fitness race track has been up and down, it has always been the focus of capital attention.
Multiple data show that the popularity of cultural and tourism consumption is on the rise, and the market is continuing to warm up.
As for the fitness market, with the steady improvement of residents' living standards and the deepening of the concept of healthy life, the fitness industry has great potential for development.
The better the situation is, the more the industry needs to pay attention to the development quality.

However, some institutions are blindly optimistic about the fitness market after the consumption recovery. Just after the crisis, they blow the trumpet of expansion and put all the financing funds into the construction of new stores.

It is undeniable that in the past few years, many institutions have withdrawn from the market due to the impact of the epidemic, and the industry has reshuffled. At this time, enterprises with strong capabilities choose to increase their acquisition efforts and restructure their business, which may be a new opportunity.
However, in order to enter a virtuous circle of development and achieve sustainable and far-reaching progress, the industry must change its traditional model and change its business strategy.
Only by making steady progress and re-establishing the trust and security of consumers can we truly win the market and the future.
Compared with building new stores to seize the market, the fitness industry currently needs to focus on optimizing services and stabilizing users with high-quality development.
First, retain users by service.
Gym belongs to the service industry. Its essence is to adhere to "user-oriented". It should focus on the user's needs and put the focus of operation on improving the quality of service.
Secondly, it is necessary to improve user experience through digital transformation.
For example, the popular Internet gym model currently allows users to pay per session and choose their own venue.
At the same time, the body data and sports data can be effectively utilized, and the social needs can be satisfied, realizing the complete service closed loop from online to offline.
Without private trainers pushing sales and without huge annual membership fees, users’ worries about fitness institutions “running away” have decreased, and their trust has increased.
In addition, we should actively explore diversified business models.

Today, sports consumption has shifted from single service to scene consumption. Fitness clubs are expected to become new consumption entrances. Surrounding products such as sports nutrition and fitness equipment required for fitness may become new profit points, providing consumers with more choices.

Nanjing real estate market sees "price difference compensation" again - chinanews.com

Yangtze Evening Post (reported by Ma Zuo Bo) Yangtze Evening Post/Zinu News reporter found on the 10th that after more than ten years, the "price guarantee agreement" has returned to the Nanjing real estate market. A residential complex in the Jiangbei New District claims to "compensate the difference in price" and offers more benefits than the previous discount for other sources of housing before the delivery. The developer is willing to exchange
The "price guarantee" conditions are not a few

The name of this residential complex located in the Jiangbei New District is Poly Yanziju Yunyuntai. Mr. Sun, a prospective buyer, told the reporter that he found a "notice" while browsing the complex last weekend.

The picture sent by him to the reporter shows that the developer of the housing estate promised that any buyers who purchased the property between February 1 and February 28 would be entitled to a refund of the difference in price if the other properties in the same building, unit, and property type were sold at a lower price than the property they had purchased.

Mr. Sun said that the property consultant said that this was actually a "price guarantee agreement", which was intended to make the buyer feel at ease to sell, and not worry about the developer lowering the price to promote sales. "Now I'm afraid that it will be lowered after I buy it. I don't have time to go to the sales office to make a fuss. If I don't make a fuss, I really feel bad."
However, many buyers think that the "price guarantee" is a "pill to calm the nerves" for buyers, but the conditions are not low.

Zheng said that she plans to buy a home in Jiangbei, and that the first requirement for the homes with price guarantee is that they must be of the same type, in the same building, and in the same unit. There are few homes that buyers can compare prices with, so the “barrier” is still quite high.

Some buyers also believe that due to the information asymmetry, it is not excluded that the seller will give additional concessions when selling, and it is not easy for the buyer to "maintain rights".
whether it can retain buyers remains to be seen

The reporter learned from the Nanjing Online Real Estate that the two buildings in the project were granted the sales permit for a total of 252 units in November last year. The types of the units include 105 square meters, 114 square meters, 129 square meters, etc. The average price of the fully decorated units is RMB 39,843 per square meter.

However, two months later, the online real estate shows that the total number of unsold units in the project is 157, accounting for 62.3%, of which 128 units in Building 8 are unsold, and 113 units in Building 7 are unsold, and the total number of units sold is only 33, accounting for 13%.
Market sources said that the "price guarantee agreement" had also appeared in Nanjing in 2008.

In August of that year, the residential building at Huangshan Road in Hexi District attracted buyers’ attention by launching the “Price Guarantee Plan”. The specific content was “the company solemnly promised that if the project’s discount increased within one year, the company would refund the difference to the old owners”.
In April 2011, 9 housing projects in Nanjing also promised to compensate the difference in price.
“The real estate market is warming up, and it needs a “heart stimulant” at this time.
"Mr. Shen, a senior operator in the real estate industry in Nanjing, said that the "price guarantee agreement" is also one of the marketing methods of real estate enterprises.

Several economic data declined, Taiwan's economy started the year poorly - chinanews.com

The export trade volume has been “black” for five consecutive months, the manufacturing purchasing managers’ index (PMI) has been tightened for seven consecutive months, and the consumer price index (CPI) has seen “three-digit” again... Recently, the Taiwan authorities have successively released the economic data of January 2023.
Experts analyzed that Taiwan's economy started the year with poor performance and faced great pressure to grow.

According to the financial affairs department of the Taiwan government, the export of Taiwan region in January this year was US$31.51 billion, down 21.2% year-on-year, and the fifth consecutive month of negative growth.
The export volume of 11 major export goods categories declined compared with the same period last year.
Plastic rubber and its products, optical equipment, the decline is the most serious, respectively, annual reduction of 37.6%, 35.7%.
Exports of electronic components and parts fell 20.1% year-on-year, the biggest decline in 11 years.
Among them, the annual decline of integrated circuits was 18.3%, the largest decline in 14 years.

The head of the statistics department, Cai Meina, said that this shows the effects of weak demand in the consumer electronics industry are spreading, and that the electronics industry is entering a period of correction.

Statistics show that in January, the import and export of Taiwan region both declined, and the export surplus amounted to only 234 million U.S. dollars, which was the lowest level in the past three years.

The Ministry of Finance of the Taiwan government believes that global terminal demand has decreased, and the adjustment of inventory has suppressed the manufacturers’ willingness to purchase raw materials. The export slump is unlikely to improve in the short term, and the export recession in Taiwan in the first quarter of this year is likely to be higher than expected.

According to the Taiwan Chung-Hua Institute for Economic Research, the Taiwan Manufacturing Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI) for January, after seasonal adjustment, was 40.4%, down 3.3 percentage points from the previous month, and has contracted for seven consecutive months.

In the economic monitoring index system, PMI is the line of prosperity and decline, and the index above 50% represents the expansion of prosperity, while the index below 50% represents the contraction.
In the five constituent indicators of Taiwan PMI in January, new orders, production and human resource hiring contracted, while supplier delivery time dropped and inventory contracted.

All six industries reported a contraction in PMI, with the industries ranked by the rate of contraction as follows: power and machinery (35.1%), electronics and optics (35.2%), chemicals and biotechnology and medical (39.2%), basic materials (42.4%), transportation (42.6%), and food and textiles (45.7%).

In terms of prices, the Taiwanese government's "Ministry of Finance" announced that the year-on-year increase rate of Taiwan's CPI in January was 3.04%, which broke through 3% again since July last year.
Among them, vegetable prices soared by 28.25%, setting a new record high in 17 months.

Cao Zhiming, a special committee member of the Bureau of Statistics of Taiwan, said frankly that the rise in vegetable prices was indeed beyond expectations. Excluding the factors of Spring Festival, the average CPI in January and February this year should be close to 2.71% of last December, and the inflationary pressure still exists and is still at a high level.
Looking at the Taiwanese economy this year, according to the reports of the domestic media such as the United Daily News and Yahoo Finance, experts expressed pessimism.

Wu Daren, professor of the Department of Economics of Chung-Ang University, analyzed that the export recession may cause the cash flow of export manufacturing enterprises to be problematic, and the risk of debt default will rise.
At the same time, the reduction of orders leads to the reduction of human resource cost of manufacturers, which affects the labor market and family economy, and then affects the consumption ability.

Taiwan Institute of Economic Research researcher Chou Dasheng believes that the inflation situation in Europe and the United States has not been resolved, and demand continues to shrink. Therefore, he estimates that the decline in Taiwan's exports will continue into the first half of the year.
Since Taiwan's economy is supported by exports, the economic growth in the whole year will be worse than that of last year due to the sluggish export.

Report: Number of overseas students returning to China for job hunting hits new high in 2022 - chinanews.com
Top 10 countries for overseas students to study in 2022. Source: “2022 China Overseas Returnees Employment Survey Report”

China News Service, Beijing, February 11 (Meng Rui) The recently released “2022 China Overseas Returnees Employment Survey Report” (hereinafter referred to as “Report”) shows that the scale of graduating overseas students in 2022 increased by 8.6% year-on-year, and the number of overseas students seeking employment in China reached a new high. The demand of Chinese enterprises for overseas talents also showed an upward trend.
The report shows that since 2020, the number of overseas Chinese who seek jobs in China has increased significantly, and the number of Chinese students who seek jobs after graduation has increased.
Compared with 2021, the scale of graduates of overseas students in 2022 increased by 8.6% year-on-year, and the number of overseas students returning to China for employment reached a new high.

From the distribution of the countries where overseas students study, the UK has the highest proportion, at 41.4%, followed by Australia (20.3%) and the United States (9%), ranking the same as in 2021.

In terms of year-on-year growth, the number of students from Malaysia, Japan and Singapore who will graduate in 2022 has increased significantly, with growth rates of 66.1%, 50.9% and 37.7%, respectively.
The number of overseas students from Canada, Germany, the United States and Australia has decreased year-on-year.
Trends in the supply and demand of overseas returnees in the first week after the Spring Festival in 2023. Source: “2022 China Overseas Returnees Employment Survey Report”

According to the survey, 58% of the overseas students who decided to return to China thought that "life in China is more convenient", 40% decided to return to China because they "more identified with the cultural environment in China", 32% thought that "there are more job opportunities in China", and 22% thought that "the economic activities in China will recover faster, and they will have more job opportunities".
Data shows that the demand for overseas talents by domestic enterprises is rapidly released, and the demand for talents returning from abroad is on the rise.

In the first week after the Spring Festival in 2023, the number of positions for overseas returnees and the number of overseas returnees seeking jobs in China both increased. The number of positions for overseas returnees on February 3 increased by 11% compared to January 28, and the number of overseas returnees seeking jobs increased by 27%.

From the industry perspective, in the 2022 overseas returnee priority positions, the positions from the education/training industry accounted for 27.8%, ranking first, while the positions from the professional services/consulting industry and the Internet/e-commerce industry ranked second and third with 14.3% and 11.1%, respectively.
The number of Chinese expatriates seeking employment in China has changed in recent years. Source: “2022 China Overseas Returnees Employment Survey Report”

From the perspective of salary, the average recruitment salary of overseas returnees’ priority positions has risen for three consecutive years, reaching 14,680 yuan/month (RMB, the same below) in 2022, an increase of 961 yuan from 13,719 yuan/month in 2021, an increase of 7%.

From the perspective of regions, the willingness of overseas returnees to develop in new first-tier cities, second-tier cities, and third- and fourth-tier cities increased in 2022. The proportions of applications to these cities were 31%, 15.7%, and 14.3%, respectively, which were all higher than those in 2021.
As for the gains of studying abroad, 52.7% of the returnees said that they were basically in line with their expectations, up 2.8 percentage points from the previous year (49.9%).
28.2% of the overseas returnees said that their income was higher than expected or much higher than expected, which was also higher than 25.4% in 2021.
(Complete)

Henan Province standardizes and integrates the price of dental implant medical services - chinanews.com

CCTV.com news: dental implants are an ideal choice for many patients with missing teeth, but the price of each implant, which is usually over RMB10,000, has deterred many patients from seeking treatment.
Since this year, with the acceleration of the collection of dental implants, various regions have also put the reduction of dental implants on the agenda.

From February 10, the price of a single regular dental implant medical service in Henan Province is controlled at RMB4,300, and the total cost of a single regular dental implant is not more than 97% of the controlled target.
Dental implants are a type of tooth restoration that uses an implant in the lower part of the structure to support and fix the upper part of the tooth restoration body.
According to the reporter, the price of a single regular transplantation is about 16,000 yuan from transplantation to the final repair at the First Affiliated Hospital of Zhengzhou University.
Patient He Ying: After the new policy, the doctor told me that my situation is about 8,000 yuan, less than 10,000 yuan, and I can save about half.

In addition to the existing items, Henan also integrated and confirmed 15 medical service price items for dental implantation, such as “implantation fee (per piece)”, and unified the price and medical insurance payment categories of provincial public medical institutions, and canceled or adjusted 20 medical service price items, such as dental implantation.

Li Yunjie, Director of the Medical Insurance and Procurement Department of Zhengzhou Medical Insurance Bureau: The beneficiaries are mainly four parties. One is the medical insurance, which has reduced its expenditure; the hospital's pressure has been reduced, and the patients will increase appropriately; the suppliers have obtained a market; and for our patients, they are the most benefited party. The cost of planting a tooth may be reduced by half or even more.
Shenzhen: Build a leading city in China and the world - chinanews.com

China News Service, February 11th - According to the message of the WeChat public account of "Shenzhen Industry and Information Technology" on February 10th, the Shenzhen Municipal Bureau of Industry and Information Technology recently issued the "Shenzhen Action Plan for Building a Smart City".

It is proposed that by the end of 2023, a super-wideband network with high speed, large capacity and low latency will be built, and the goal of "double gigabit, all optical network, 1 millisecond, and the Internet of Things" network construction will be achieved, and the world's leading ultra-fast leading city will be built.
The plan proposes to speed up the upgrading of gigabit optical fiber network.
By the end of 2023, the proportion of 10G PON ports will reach 100%, and the number of all-optical industrial parks (industrial parks) will exceed 100.
The plan requires that the energy efficiency of 5G networks be comprehensively improved.
Research and formulate the quality standards and norms of Shenzhen's 5G network services, conduct 5G network testing and evaluation, and improve the quality of 5G network services.

Support the basic telecommunications enterprises to increase the optimization of 5G networks in key areas and venues, and add 10,000 5G base stations in the whole year. The average download rate in the city is 500 Mbps, and the average upload rate is 100 Mbps. The download rate in the key areas is 1000 Mbps, and the upload rate is 200 Mbps. The network speed and user experience are greatly improved.
build a city-level high-quality wireless local area network.

Formulate the service standards of public place wireless local area network (WLAN), promote the upgrading of WLAN in the concentrated areas of personnel and information consumption demand in all districts of the city, and provide the access capability of 1000M.

We will build a unified authentication and supervision platform for the city's public wireless local area network based on "Shenzhen i-network", so as to achieve "one-time authentication, seamless roaming, and intelligent switching", and support the operation subject to include the social self-built AP (wireless access point) with public service capability in the authentication and supervision platform.
By the end of 2023, the total number of upgraded access points will not be less than 20,000.

In addition, the plan also proposes to build a high-quality all-optical transport network, construct a multi-level computing power supply system, accelerate the construction of key communication network facilities, and improve the Internet application service capability.
The plan clearly states that we should collaborate to build an Internet of Things perception system.

Exploring the construction management model of urban perception terminal based on the open source HONGMENG operating system, reducing the cost of interconnection, and accelerating the construction of urban level Internet of Things perception platform, and promoting the interconnection and intercommunication of networks and data of urban area Internet of Things platform and professional Internet of Things platform in various fields.

Deepen the application of the Internet of Things in urban management, public services, public security, traffic and other fields, and expand the channels of fixed perception and intelligent connected vehicles for collecting perception.

By the end of 2023, the number of water, electricity, gas and internet of things perception terminals will exceed 9 million, and 20 multi-functional smart lampposts application demonstration projects will be built.

The plan also mentions that it will strengthen the integration of satellite and ground communications, lay out the construction of low-altitude network infrastructure, and promote the deep coverage of 5G networks at sea.
At the same time, it will promote the deep coverage of 5G network at sea, build an ecosystem for industrial innovation and development, and support the hosting of top-level competitions and events.

The Chinese e-commerce industry is experiencing a "new variable", how to achieve "content is king" in live streaming?
Chinanews is an important news website in China.
China News Service, February 11: Title: The Chinese e-commerce industry is surging with "new variables". How to achieve "content is king" in the process of carrying goods?
watching you gentlemen of the press all morning.
“We entered the e-commerce industry late, but we realized from the very beginning that in order to stand out from the millions of stores, content is important.
A 90s girl from Guangdong, Fang Fang, now runs a tonic food store on Douyin e-commerce, which has been in business for more than 30 years, and has blossomed online.
Imitating the film tone of old Hong Kong films and accompanied by classic Cantonese songs, opening @ Fangfang's one-person food account on TikTok, the exquisite videos are refreshing.

At the recent TikTok e-commerce "Find the Fellow Travelers - Quality Content Sharing Special", Fang Fang, as a representative of quality creators, spoke at the event and introduced her experiences and insights in daily creation.

She said at the scene, "The carefully edited video has attracted a lot of attention from netizens. Many people are interested in the ingredients in my family, and want to make delicious food with me. The sales have opened up.

Fangfang used the video of cooking soup to make more people love "Guangzhou's taste". In a live broadcast, the most sold out 300,000 pieces of tonic ingredients saved the family's old shop from bankruptcy.
“No content, no e-commerce”, as short videos and live e-commerce continue to develop, people’s requirements and standards for e-commerce content are entering a new stage.
In the early stage of live streaming shopping, the live streaming room often attracts users with low prices and discounts. The price advantage seems to be the only selling point at that time.

In recent years, there have been both phenomenon-level large V such as Liu Geng Hong and Dongfang Zhen Xuan, as well as many unknown talents and merchants who appear in the vertical niche market. They improve their long-term business benefits by continuously creating high-quality content that is in line with their brand personality.

Gao Yaxuan, the manager of the operation of the e-commerce stars on Douyin, said that in the past year, 6.27 million creators have turned their content into real money through Douyin e-commerce, and their content creation has increased by 252%, and the total turnover has doubled.
“Behind these numbers, we can feel the vigorous growth and vitality of the author community.
“I’m afraid I’ll be late,” said Gao Yaxuan.

Beijing Normal University’s Communication Innovation and Future Media Experimental Platform previously released the “E-Commerce Industry Content Ecosystem Health Index (ECHI) Report”, which analyzed the importance of “new variables” - quality content in the current e-commerce industry from the perspective of data, and used the index to evaluate the content ecosystem of 27 mainstream e-commerce platforms in China.
According to the ranking of the content ecosystem health index in the e-commerce industry in the above report, Tik Tok e-commerce, Kuaishou, Taobao, Pinduoduo, and JD.com ranked the top five.

The report believes that the content ecosystem of e-commerce is a comprehensive concept, which integrates e-commerce and content, but not all content can be integrated with e-commerce. Good PGC (professional production content) and UGC (user-generated content) are the best carriers for integration with e-commerce. The higher the value of content platforms, the richer the consumption and promotion scenarios, the higher the possibility of e-commerce implantation, and the stronger the commercial value. The proportion of e-commerce content

At the scene, Yu Guoming, professor of the School of Journalism and Communication of Beijing Normal University and chairman of the China Media Economy and Management Professional Committee, analyzed and interpreted the report.

He said that in terms of content value, the e-commerce industry has now transitioned from the "accessibility of consumption" to the "quality of consumption" stage, and that high-quality, professional, and differentiated content is the "hard currency" of the e-commerce industry.

At the same time, content has become the fundamental and handle of the new stage of e-commerce development. Knowledge payment, professional knowledge, KOL (key opinion leader) and other PGC contents have begun to become standard in e-commerce live broadcast.
Looking to the future of the e-commerce industry, Yu Guoming made two suggestions.

One is to improve the content structure from the perspective of promoting the overall improvement of the health and quality of e-commerce content ecology, creating positive content creation and management standards, and realizing the e-commerce industry content ecology health system index and dynamic balance.
Another is to look at the external ecosystem. To achieve the healthy development of the content e-commerce industry and the value co-creation and co-creation of the external environment.

“In the future, the e-commerce industry will need more support from data and artificial intelligence to form a stable prediction of future development; in addition, it will provide a more standardized and healthy growth space for merchants to realize the value of cooperation among enterprises, users, products, and services in the e-commerce industry, and co-create a healthy content ecosystem.
Beijing Stock Exchange to launch margin trading business next week - chinanews.com

This newspaper reported (correspondent Sun Jie) last night that the Beijing Stock Exchange announced that after the approval of the China Securities Regulatory Commission, the margin trading business of the Beijing Stock Exchange will be officially launched on February 13. At that time, the securities companies that have obtained the margin trading rights of the Beijing Stock Exchange can accept the delegation of investors and apply for margin trading to the Beijing Stock Exchange.
The list of the first batch of 56 stocks for margin lending and margin selling was determined on January 31, 2023.

The list of stocks for margin trading and the list of securities that can be used as collateral will be published in the "Information Disclosure - Margin Trading Information" column on the official website of the North China Stock Exchange, which will facilitate investors' inquiries.
Margin trading is an important basic system in the securities market, and is also a relatively mature trading method in the international securities market.
On September 2 last year, on the occasion of the one-year anniversary, the North Exchange publicly solicited opinions on the financing and margin business.

The launch of the financing and margin trading on the North Exchange is an important measure to continuously promote the construction of the North Exchange market system, improve the trading mechanism, and enhance the pricing function of the secondary market.

The margin trading system is beneficial to enriching the trading strategies of investors, satisfying the diversified trading needs of investors, promoting the discovery of market prices, and further improving the liquidity of the market.

Next, the North Exchange will continue to do a good job in all aspects of the financing and securities business under the leadership of the China Securities Regulatory Commission, and will enrich the transaction system tools with the needs of investors as the guide, improve the relevant supporting mechanisms, and focus on building a first-class exchange to serve innovative small and medium-sized enterprises.
The 16th China-Japan Energy Conservation and Environmental Protection Forum was held in Beijing. He Lifeng attended the main forum and delivered a keynote speech-China News Network
Xinhua News Agency, Beijing, February 11 -- On February 11, the 16th China-Japan Energy Conservation and Environmental Protection Forum was held in Beijing in a combined online and offline manner.
He Lifeng, member of the CPC Central Committee and head of the National Development and Reform Commission, attended the main forum and gave the keynote speech.

He Lifeng pointed out that holding this forum is an important measure to implement the consensus reached by President Xi Jinping and Prime Minister Kishida Fumio at the Bangkok meeting and strengthen the cooperation in green development between China and Japan.

China will comprehensively implement the spirit of the 20th CPC National Congress, accelerate the green transformation of development patterns, deepen the prevention and control of environmental pollution, comprehensively strengthen resource conservation, and actively and prudently promote carbon peaking and carbon neutrality. It will also promote the reduction of carbon emissions, pollution reduction, green expansion, and economic growth, and promote ecological priority, intensive use, and green and low-carbon development.

China is willing to continue to deepen the cooperation in green and low-carbon industries, technology, policy dialogue and people-to-people exchanges with Japan, and jointly promote the green development cooperation between the two countries to new heights.
Japan's Minister of Economy, Trade and Industry Yasutoshi Nishimura attended the main forum and delivered a keynote speech.

The forum was jointly hosted by the National Development and Reform Commission of China, the Ministry of Commerce, the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry of Japan, and the Japan-China Economic Association. Representatives from the governments, enterprises and institutions of China and Japan exchanged views.

China News Service, February 11, 2019: According to the news on the website of the Ministry of Emergency Management on February 11, on February 10, the Chinese rescue team in Turkey dispatched three action teams and 45 rescue personnel to rescue one trapped person.

He has communicated with the Italian, British, Serbian, Slovakian, Omani and other teams, and learned about the rescue work of the United Nations rescue organization and the rescue teams of various countries.

continuously run the duty and post system, and strengthen the safety management of the camp.

(Deutsche Welle Chinese) On Friday, February 10, the Biden administration blacklisted six Chinese entities suspected of participating in the balloon espionage program.

The U.S. Department of Commerce said that these five Chinese companies and one research institute helped the Chinese military to modernize, especially in aerospace projects, including airships and aircraft.
Companies on the blacklist will have a hard time getting US technology exports.

The list is known as the “entity list”, and companies on the list will not be able to purchase technology or goods from U.S. suppliers unless they obtain a special export license from the U.S. Department of Commerce.

The companies on the blacklist are: Beijing Nanjiang Aerospace Technology Co., Ltd., the 48th Research Institute of China Electronics Technology Group, Dongguan Lingkong Remote Sensing Technology Co., Ltd., the Eagle Gate Aviation Technology Group Co., Ltd., Guangzhou Tianhai Xiang Aviation Technology Co., Ltd., and Shanxi Eagle Gate Aviation Technology Group Co., Ltd.
Before that, the White House said it was considering a broader measure to "expose and address" China's larger-scale surveillance activities that pose a threat to U.S. national security.
The balloon incident has caused further tension between China and the United States, and US Secretary of State Blinken has cancelled his visit to China.

On February 4, the Chinese government lodged a solemn protest with the US embassy in China, criticizing the US for seriously undermining and damaging the efforts and progress made by both sides to maintain stable Sino-US relations.

From the existing wreckage evidence and the information of the procurement platform of the Chinese military, the US government has concluded that the manufacturer of the balloon is "directly related to the Chinese People's Liberation Army" and is a supplier approved by the Chinese military.

Mao Ning, spokesperson of the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs, said at a press conference on Friday that regarding the incident of a Chinese civilian balloon entering the US airspace due to force majeure, China has repeatedly explained the situation and clarified its position.
According to the website of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, she added that the relevant resolution of the US Congress was a political manipulation and hype.
China is firmly opposed to and strongly dissatisfied with that.

"The actions taken today demonstrate our shared commitment to identify and stop China's use of espionage balloons that violate the airspace of the United States and more than 40 other countries," said Matthew Axelrod, the assistant secretary of commerce for enforcement and compliance.
A worker at Guangzhou Tianhaxiang Aviation Technology Co. Ltd. told Reuters that he was unaware of the sanctions and declined to comment further, Reuters reported.
The Chinese embassy in the United States and the Chinese embassy in the United Kingdom have not yet commented on these information.
(Reuters and others)
