(Deutsche Welle Chinese) Several days after the earthquake hit some parts of Turkey and Syria, the hope of finding survivors is fading, but the rescue team was relieved to find a family of five who were rescued on Saturday.
In the hard-hit town of Nurdağı in Gaziantep province, this family of five was rescued after being trapped under rubble for more than five days, the Associated Press reported.
The rescuers first pulled out the mother and daughter from the debris, and then found the father, but he insisted on saving his son and another daughter first.
Outside, the crowd applauded.
In the southern Turkish city of Kahramanmaras, a 16-year-old boy and a 70-year-old woman were also rescued from the harsh cold weather.
I forgot what day it is today.
“- this boy who was trapped under the rubble for 129 hours asked the rescuers who saved him.
A man from Kahramanmaras holds his cat after it was rescued
The miraculous rescue of survivors has given the search and rescue operation a glimmer of hope, but the number of casualties is still rising.
According to official statistics, the earthquake on Monday has caused more than 20,000 deaths in Turkey, and the death toll in neighboring Syria is estimated to be more than 3,500.
Although experts say people can survive for more than a week after being trapped in rubble, the chances of finding more survivors are becoming increasingly slim.
Rescuers are still using thermal imaging to search for signs of life under the rubble.
But now the fight begins to help the people who survived.
UN official: 'Century of disasters' in the region

Martin Griffiths, the UN's under-secretary general for humanitarian affairs and emergency relief coordinator, said at a news conference in Turkey that the earthquake was "the worst disaster in the region in a century."
He also praised Turkey's post-disaster response as "unprecedented."
He also told Reuters that he hoped to provide aid to areas controlled by both the Syrian government and opposition forces, but said the details were "not clear."
The United Nations has pledged an additional $25 million in aid to the people of Syria affected by the earthquake.
Earlier this week, the United Nations announced it had allocated $25 million in aid to Turkey and Syria.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Chile , Pacific Rim
At 3:11 pm local time on May 22, 1960, the largest earthquake ever recorded by humans occurred in Valdivia, Chile, with a seismic moment magnitude of 9.5.
The whole city of Valdivia was reduced to rubble in a matter of minutes.
The tremor caused localised tsunamis that severely battered the Chilean coast, with waves up to 25 metres (82 ft).
Waves as high as 10.7 metres (35 ft) were recorded 10,000 kilometres (6,200 mi) from the epicenter, and as far away as Japan and the Philippines.
The death toll and monetary losses arising from this widespread disaster are not certain.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Alaska's Good Friday earthquake
March 27, 1964 was a Friday and Good Friday.
On this day, the largest earthquake in the history of North America occurred in Alaska, with a moment magnitude of 9.2.
Until 2006, the Great Alaska Earthquake remained the third largest earthquake on record.
When the earthquake occurred, a fault between the Pacific Plate and the North American Plate broke near the College Fjord in Prince William Sound.
The earthquake lasted for three to five minutes in most areas.
The seabed displacement triggered a massive tsunami with a height of 67 meters.
Schools and many businesses remain closed in Bangui, owing to rampant insecurity.
The earthquake ultimately killed 139 people.
Nine people died directly from the earthquake, and 130 died from the tsunami triggered by the earthquake.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Tangshan earthquake (1976)
On July 28, 1976, two earthquakes with a magnitude of 7 or more occurred in Tangshan and Fengnan counties of Hebei Province in 16 hours.
The epicenter was 23 kilometers from the ground.
The whole city of Tangshan was cut off from traffic, communication, water supply and power supply, and was destroyed in an instant.
The earthquake was felt strongly in Beijing, 140 kilometers away.
According to official statistics, including Beijing and Tianjin, all the disaster-stricken areas, the earthquake caused 242769 deaths and 164851 serious injuries.
The Tangshan earthquake became the second deadliest earthquake in China's recorded history, second only to the 1556 Shaanxi earthquake.
However, overseas scientists estimate that this earthquake may have caused at least 650,000 deaths.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Indian Ocean Earthquake (2004)
On December 26, 2004, an earthquake occurred in the west coast of Aceh province, Sumatra Island, Indonesia, 160 km away from the epicenter, with a depth of 30 km and a moment magnitude of 9.1-9.3.
The earthquake triggered a substantial tsunami with waves as high as 15 to 30 meters.

A total of 14 countries along the Pacific coast were affected by the disaster, with the most severely affected areas including the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh, the Thai provinces of Chonburi and Phuket, Sri Lanka and the Indian state of Tamil Nadu.

The disaster struck during the peak tourist season of Christmas, with many tourists and local residents in the affected areas, causing many tourists enjoying their holidays on the beach and local people working by the sea to be swept away by the tsunami and become missing.
It is estimated that at least 300,000 people died and tens of thousands went missing.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Sichuan earthquake, 2008
On 12 May 2008, a gigantic earthquake took place in Wenchuan, in China ' s Sichuan Province.

According to the data of China Earthquake Administration, the surface wave magnitude of this earthquake reached 8.2 and the moment magnitude reached 8.3. The area of destruction exceeded 100,000 square kilometers.

As of September 25, 2008, the earthquake has caused 69227 deaths, 17923 missing, 374643 injuries of different degrees, 19.903 million people lost their homes, and the total population affected by the disaster is 46.256 million.
It is the most destructive earthquake in the history of the People's Republic of China, and also the most serious casualties after the earthquake in Tangshan.

On March 2009, the State Council of China announced that May 12 of each year would be designated as National Disaster Prevention and Reduction Day to strengthen the education of the public and the attention to disaster prevention and reduction work.
Afterwards, governments and primary and secondary schools in many parts of China hold anti-earthquake drills every year on this day.
Primary and secondary schools also began to pay attention to the popularization of "earthquake prevention and mitigation" education.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
2010 Haiti earthquake
On January 12, 2010, a 7.0-magnitude earthquake struck the Caribbean island nation of Haiti.
The epicenter was located 25 kilometers south of the capital Port-au-Prince, and the source of the earthquake was about 13 kilometers below the surface.
The International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies estimated that as many as 3 million people had been affected by the quake.
Haiti's government has placed the confirmed death toll at over 200,000.
Almost 90% of houses in this village were destroyed by the earthquake.
Although the international community has provided a great deal of aid and support, this overpopulated, corrupt, and impoverished country has never recovered from the disaster.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Category: 2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami
On March 11, 2011, a large megathrust earthquake with a moment magnitude of 9.0 occurred off the northeast coast of Japan.

The epicenter was located in the Pacific Ocean east of Sendai, the capital of Miyagi Prefecture, and the depth of the earthquake was measured at 24 km, and it triggered a huge tsunami with a maximum wave height of 40.1 m.
It was the first earthquake in Japan with a magnitude of more than 9.
About 22,000 people died in the disaster, and about 400,000 buildings were completely destroyed or collapsed.
The Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant was affected by the earthquake and tsunami, causing leakage of radioactive substances.
This accident was classified as the most serious level 7 on the International Nuclear Event Scale (INES).
The Fukushima nuclear accident caused the detection of minute amounts of radioactive substances in the world, including iodine-131 and caesium-137 (with a half-life of 30 years).
A large amount of radioactive isotopes was released into the Pacific Ocean as a result of the nuclear accident.
According to the statistics of the United Nations, at least 870,000 people in the disaster areas of Syria and Turkey urgently need food.
Just in Syria, more than 5.3 million people have been displaced by the conflict.
The World Food Program has called for $77 million in funding to provide food for the displaced victims of the earthquake in Turkey and Syria.
The temperature in the disaster area is as low as zero, and many victims have no shelter.
The Turkish government has distributed large amounts of hot meals, tents and blankets, but these supplies are still difficult to reach many people in need.
In Syria, which has been mired in a civil war for 12 years, the earthquake has made the people's difficult situation worse.
In the four days since the earthquake, WFP has already provided food assistance to 115,000 people in Turkey and Syria.
The World Health Organization (WHO) sent 72 tons of medical supplies for treating injuries and emergency surgery.
(Associated Press, Reuters, etc.)

In his reply, Xi Jinping said that you have overcome difficulties in work and life in Central Africa, and served the local people with your heart. You are not only white-clad angels who save lives, but also friendly envoys who convey friendship.

In 1963, China dispatched the first medical team to Algeria.

Google AI chatbot "answers wrong questions" and its parent company's stock price evaporates $10 billion
(Combined news on November 11)

Google's new AI chatbot Bard has had a rocky start, with a promotional video showing it answering a question incorrectly, causing Google's parent company Alphabet to fall 8.9% on Thursday, breaking through the $100 mark, and wiping out $110 billion in market value (RM47.65 billion), closing at $94.57 on Friday.
The market is worried that Alphabet is not as good as its competitor Microsoft.

According to a report by Reuters, Google earlier released a promotional video of its AI chatbot Bard on social media. In the video, someone asks Bard: "What new discoveries about the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) can I tell my 9-year-old child?
Bard mentioned in his answer that the telescope had taken the first picture of an extrasolar planet.

However, according to the data of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration, the first picture of the exoplanet was taken by the Extremely Large Telescope of the European Southern Observatory in 2004.
Reuters reported the news with the headline "Alphabet's stock price plunges after Bard's wrong answers".

On the other hand, Google pointed out that Bard's response "highlights the importance of rigorous testing process", which will combine external feedback with its own internal testing to ensure that Bard's response "meets high standards in terms of quality, safety and real information".
Singapore's tourism industry rebounds strongly, with inbound tourists up 19 times from 2021

(Singapore, November 11) The Singapore Tourism Board recently announced that it is expected that the number of international visitors to Singapore in 2023 will reach 12 million to 14 million, which will bring about tourism revenue of about S$18 billion to S$21 billion; the number of visitors and tourism revenue will recover to about 67% to 75% of the level before the COVID-19 pandemic in 2019; and it is very likely that the tourism industry will
The tourism market in Singapore gradually re-started and recovered in 2022.

The latest statistics released by the Singapore Tourism Board show that the number of inbound tourists increased by 19 times from 330,600 in 2021 to 6.3 million in 2022, exceeding the earlier estimate of 4-6 million by the Tourism Board. The number of tourists has recovered to 33% of the pre-epidemic level.

From January to September 2022, Singapore’s tourism revenue totaled 8.96 billion Singapore dollars, and it is expected that the tourism revenue in 2022 will reach 13.8 billion to 14.3 billion Singapore dollars, which is 6 to 7 times higher than that in 2021 (1.89 billion Singapore dollars), and has recovered to about 50% to 52% of the level before the COVID-19 pandemic in 2019.<
The Singapore government has taken multiple measures to accelerate the recovery of the tourism industry.
In April 2022, the government announced that it would allocate nearly S$500 million to stimulate the recovery of the tourism industry.

The Ministry of Tourism recently announced that it plans to allocate 110 million Singapore dollars from this budget in the next two years to launch more commercial and leisure activities to attract tourists to return.

In order to make health and wellness one of the tourism highlights of Singapore, the Singapore Tourism Board launched an expression of interest campaign on November 23, 2022, to develop a health and wellness destination on the southern coast of Singapore.

Wang Lingli, the director of the Executive Office of Sports and Health Tourism of the Singapore Tourism Board, said that in recent years, more and more tourists have put their physical health as the first consideration.

Developing a wellness destination in Marina South, which includes Gardens by the Bay and Marina Barrage, will contribute to Singapore’s tourism and economy by encouraging tourists to spend more time and money in Singapore.
Chen Jianlong, the director of Singapore Tourism Board, said that in the next few years, health and longevity will become an important part of Singapore’s tourism products.
The COVID-19 pandemic has raised public awareness and demand for physical and mental health.
For this purpose, the Tourism Bureau has been promoting health and wellness programs to local residents and international tourists for the past two years.
In June 2022, the Singapore Tourism Board held the first Wellness Festival, offering more than 130 wellness activities and experiences to the public.
Singapore will continue to offer new travel experiences to visitors.

In addition to the newly opened Children’s Museum of Singapore, the Avatar World at Gardens by the Bay, the Central Beach Market at Sentosa, the new “Explore New Frontiers” gallery at the ArtScience Museum, and the new open-air theatre at Night Safari, the Ministry of Trade and Industry will support the development and renewal of Jurong Bird Park and other projects at the Wild Wild Wet World to make Singapore an attractive international tourist destination.

According to the plan, Singapore will formulate the industry standards for the sustainable development of the meeting, exhibition and incentive tourism by the end of 2023, and focus on improving the waste treatment and carbon emissions, further optimizing the tourism environment.
Singapore's tourism recovery is accelerating the recovery of the aviation industry.

Data shows that as of December 18, 2022, Changi Airport has seen a strong recovery in passenger traffic, with daily passenger traffic reaching as high as 150,000, weekly passenger traffic reaching as high as 1 million, which is equivalent to 75% of pre-pandemic levels. The number of aviation industry employees on duty has also recovered to about 90% of pre-pandemic levels.

According to the statistics, Singapore has received 23.6 million tourists from January to October 2022, which is equivalent to 42% of the pre-epidemic period. The number of take-off and landing flights is 170,000, which is 53% of the pre-epidemic period.
The tourism industry is recovering rapidly, which also drives the recovery of the hospitality, transportation, catering and shopping industries.
The Singapore government and tourism industry have high expectations for the Chinese market.

Koh Shu Dan, the assistant director of the International Department of the Singapore Tourism Board, said that a survey conducted by a Chinese travel platform showed that Singapore ranked third in the world in terms of safety, which is also one of the reasons why Singapore is so popular with Chinese tourists.
Before the COVID-19 pandemic, about 3.6 million Chinese tourists traveled to Singapore for vacation each year.
With the relaxation of China's border policy, it is expected that the number of Chinese tourists will recover to 30% to 60% of that in 2019 this year.

Ko Shu-tan pointed out that in the future, the Tourism Bureau will pay close attention to the signals of further release of outbound travel policies by China, in order to cope with the changes of tourist demand.

In addition to strengthening partnership with online travel platforms and travel agencies in China such as Ctrip, the Singapore Tourism Board will also actively prepare to receive Chinese tourists in response to the new trends of overseas travel by Chinese tourists.

Looking ahead to the tourism market in 2023, the Singapore Tourism Board is confident that the tourism industry will recover faster than expected as long as the global economy does not experience a significant recession that affects public income, and there are no new large-scale outbreaks of deadly diseases.
Kim Jong-un and his daughter interacted closely, while his wife was left out

(Combined report on the 11th) North Korea held a military parade on the evening of August 8 to celebrate the 75th anniversary of the founding of the military. Kim Jong-un's daughter Kim Ju-ae not only attended the event, but also stood on the podium with her father.

On the 9th, the North Korean official media released the film. Kim Ju-ae leaned on her father, and looked at him with affection and whispered to him. She held her father's face with her hands, and even touched her father's chest. The father and daughter's mutual painting was broadcasted to the whole country.

Kim Jong-un looked at his daughter several times on the podium, and the smile on their faces never faded. They whispered to each other, and Kim Jong-lo loved once held his father's cheeks with both hands. Kim Jong-un also responded with a smile.

The U.S. labor market still has a supply gap of more than 5 million, while the labor participation rate is rising slowly, especially the labor participation rate of 25-54 years old has approached the peak before the epidemic.
In addition, due to the strong excess savings and consumer credit of American residents, the strong demand for consumption will further delay the impact of tightening policy on the employment market.
The tight supply and demand in the US labor market will be the underlying tone of the US economy in 2023.
Adding to the fact that the interest rate hike is about to end, and the inflation expectation keeps fluctuating, we are not optimistic about the continuous decline of wage growth.
Before the release of this data, the U.S. stock, bond and foreign exchange markets were overly optimistic about the path of interest rate increases by the Federal Reserve.

As inflation data continued to improve, the Fed maintained a fragile balance of market inflation expectations while shortening the pace of interest rate hikes, but the market ignored the Fed's hawkish rhetoric, not only expecting to stop raising interest rates, but also expecting two interest rate cuts by the end of the year.

In the context of tight supply and demand in the labor market and the uncertain impact of tightening policies, we believe that the Fed's guidance on interest rate hikes at the end of the year is relatively reasonable. The adjustment of extreme expectations and trading congestion may cause some damage to the market.

However, the stubbornness of wage growth will not change the current trend of rapid decline in inflation, and with the M2 data turning negative and the leading indicators of various CPI items gradually improving, the U.S. CPI data has turned to a rapid decline phase since October, and the stubbornness of wage growth will only form a bottom for future inflation data, and the current market expectations are difficult to disprove, and the market may enter a new round of bargaining after the next inflation data
Zheng Yonggang, the founder of Shanshui, died of sudden cardiac disease. He once led the transformation of China's first clothing stock.

Economic Observation Network, reporter Zheng Yuexin, on February 11, the certification subject is Shanshan Holdings Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as "Shanshan Holdings") WeChat public account issued a notice, Shanshan Enterprise founder, Shanshan Holdings Chairman Zheng Yonggang died of sudden cardiac disease on February 10, 2023, aged 65.

In the 1980s, Zheng Yonggang was the director of a state-owned cotton spinning plant. In 1989, he became the director of Ningbo Yunhong Clothing Plant, which was the predecessor of Shanshan Shareholding.

In December 2022, at the 20th China Enterprise Leaders Forum and the 22nd China Future Star Forum, Zheng Yonggang said in his speech that in the Chinese suit market in the 1990s, the market share of the Shanshan brand once reached 37%.
In 1996, Shanshui Share (600884.SH) was listed and became the first listed company in China's clothing industry.

Just as the clothing business was at its peak, Shanshan Group began to transform, because Zheng Yonggang realized that “once the market is opened, Chinese brands will naturally form a tiered brand market, and it is unlikely that Shanshan suits will continue to dominate the market and become the national suits of the Chinese people. ”

In 1999, Shu Shu began to study the transformation of enterprises. Zheng Yonggang recalled that year, “We came to Shanghai to find out what to do for transformation. We specially found many experts and scholars, and held some Zhuge Liang meetings and empty research conferences continuously.
Finally, we set two major strategic directions.
The first direction is new energy and new materials, and the other is big health with future prospects. ”

After the strategic direction was determined, Shanshan began to look for cooperation. At that time, the carbon research institute of Anshan Heat Energy Institute was doing the national 863 project for Ansteel. The research and development funds were insufficient, so Shanshan and the carbon research institute of Anshan Heat Energy Institute signed a cooperation agreement to jointly promote the industrialization of the national 863 project "intermediate phase carbon microspheres". They are engaged in the research, production

In 2001, Shanshan Co., Ltd. achieved the scale production of mesophase carbon microspheres, and began to replace the domestic production. It replaced Japan as the main supplier of mesophase carbon microspheres in China.
This is the first lithium-ion battery negative electrode material production enterprise in China, which has realized the domestic production of lithium-ion battery negative electrode material.

With the rapid popularization of lithium batteries, the lithium battery business of Shaoteng shares began to develop gradually. In 2007, the lithium battery material business was written into the main business of Shaoteng shares. The revenue of clothing business accounted for a decreasing proportion year by year, and in 2013, the revenue of lithium battery material business of Shaoteng shares exceeded that of clothing business.

In February 2021, Shanshui Group successfully acquired LG Chemical's polarizer business and entered the LCD polarizer market, and established the polarizer enterprise Shanshui Guangdian. The technical content in this field is relatively high, and the main competitors of Shanshui Group are all world 500 strong companies, such as Samsung of South Korea, Sumitomo Chemical of Japan, and Nitto Denko.

Zheng Yonggang once shared his experience in post-investment management, “The probability of success of Chinese private enterprises’ acquisition of some high-tech enterprises abroad is relatively low. Why do these acquisitions fail?

Because everyone will consider, I spent so much money, I have to send people to manage, this is a common behavior, "However, Izhar Shay is different, on the day of the acquisition success, Izhar Shay went to Shinko Electric to announce in public that Shinko as the major shareholder of Shinko Electric, decided to implement two systems, except that Izhar Shay is the chairman, Shinko Electric will not send people to Shinko

ICC Xinshuo Information released the data of negative electrode in 2022, showing that the sales volume of Shanshan negative electrode in 2022 broke through 200,000 tons, with a year-on-year increase of 100%, and the market share reached 16%, and the sales volume of artificial graphite negative electrode material ranked first.

In the polarizer business, Yano Research statistics show that the market share of the company's subsidiary Sugon Electric in the global market reached 29% in 2022, and it is expected to reach 32% in 2023, ranking first in the world.

In the first three quarters of 2022, the revenue of Shanshui Shareholding was 15.841 billion yuan, and the net profit was 2.313 billion yuan. On February 10, the share price of Shanshui Shareholding was 19.24 yuan per share, and the total market value was 43.6 billion yuan.

On February 9, Shanshan Stock expressed on the interactive platform that by the end of 2022, the company's effective graphitization production capacity was approximately 100,000 tons, and the graphitization production capacity of the Meishan project was still in the process of ramping up.
According to Wandian, Zheng Yonggang is still the chairman and actual controller of Shanshui Shareholding.
According to Tianyancha, Zheng Yonggang holds a total equity proportion of 40.1% in Shanshan Holdings Co., Ltd.

The general manager of Shanshan shares is Li Zhihua, born in 1968, and has served as the chairman of Dongguan Shanshan Battery Material Co., Ltd., Ningbo Shanshan New Material Technology Co., Ltd., Hunan Shanshan Energy Technology Co., Ltd., and vice general manager of Ningbo Shanshan Co., Ltd.
On February 10, Shanshan Stock said on the investor interaction platform that the senior management of the company and the actual controller of the company do not have any relatives.

“Fund E-account” has come: the China Securities Regulatory Commission has authorized the development of the fund E-account, and investors can realize the aggregation and inquiry of all funds under their names - www.eeo.com.cn - Professional Financial News Website
Economic Observation Network Reporter Chen Shang Fund purchase channels are complicated, which makes it difficult to collect account information?
Always forgetting the "small savings box"?
These problems of the fund will be solved soon.
On February 10, the China Securities Regulatory Commission announced that the “Fund E Account” APP was available for download in various mobile app stores and was open for public trial operation.

It is reported that the "fund E account" provides a "one-stop" inquiry service for the account and share information of public funds for individual investors, which aims to solve the industry service pain points such as forgetting the account and complicated inquiry for a large number of small and medium-sized investors.

According to Wind data, as of the end of 2022, there are 156 domestic public fund managers, with a total fund scale of about RMB 2.6 trillion; there are 167 public fund share registration institutions and 411 public fund sales institutions.
The individual quota registration mechanism accounts are mutually independent, and there is no unified query channel for the industry.
Industry insiders said that by the end of 2021, the number of fund investors in China exceeded 720 million, which means that half of the people in the country invested in fund products.

Previously, investors had to inquire about the purchase situation through different sales institutions, but through the "fund E account", they can inquire about the purchase situation in all sales channels, and the holding situation of the fund is clear at a glance.
What is the "Fund E Account" APP?

According to relevant documents, the "Fund E Account" APP is a mobile application developed and built by the China Settlement Corporation, approved by the China Securities Regulatory Commission, and is the industry gateway of the public fund industry. It can provide investors with a one-stop inquiry of the off-market holding of the public fund products.

Investors can conveniently and quickly grasp the situation of holding the off-exchange shares of the public mutual fund products of the fund managers through the "fund E account" through all sales channels in the city, and comprehensively improve the query efficiency.

Specifically, the information that investors can inquire through the "fund E account" includes: the fund account information opened at the fund management people of the whole market, the transaction account information opened at the sales institution of the public fund, and the off-exchange holding situation of the products including the public fund and the collective asset management plan, which is not limited to 200 investors, opened by the investor.

Liu Yiqian, the head of the business of Shanghai Securities Fund Evaluation Research Center, told the reporter of Economic Observer that investors can get to know their holding status of all public mutual funds through the “Fund E Account” App, which helps them to find their “forgotten assets”. More importantly, it helps customers to collect the whole account information of their comprehensive fund investment, so that customers can better grasp their investment status in a more timely, accurate and complete way,
How register for api

The reporter noticed that the "fund E account" APP has been listed in Huawei, Apple, Xiaomi, OPPO, vivo and other mobile application stores, but the APP is still in the public trial operation stage, and registration requires filling in the invitation code, and investors can contact the fund manager of the fund they hold to obtain it.

A customer service staff of a large and medium-sized public fund in Shanghai provided a 6-digit invitation code to the reporter of the Economic Observer, and told the reporter, “The APP is in the trial operation stage. The Chinese Clearing provides a certain number of invitation codes to each fund manager. Investors can call to get them. We will provide them.
After the trial run is over, users will be able to register without an invitation code.

The reporter registered the account and completed the inquiry by downloading and using the relevant documents of the "fund E account" published on the official website of the China Securities Regulatory Commission. The whole process took only a few minutes, and it was mainly divided into four steps: user registration, real-name authentication, fund account binding, and public offering fund inquiry.

After the step of real-name authentication, click the "asset" fund binding button, and the reporter's fund products purchased through various fund sales platforms are presented in the binding options list (can be bound accounts), after binding, the total assets of the invested fund can be seen directly and the query function can be started.
It is worth noting that the "fund E account" only provides query services for investors and cannot perform redemption and purchase.
The data date shown in the “Fund E Account” is generally the date three trading days before the date on which the user makes the inquiry (T day).

For example, when you open the "fund E account" on February 10, the total assets, fund shares and fund net value shown on the asset page correspond to the date three trading days before, that is, February 7.

The US, Japan and the Philippines reached a consensus on defense cooperation against China
Asia - On February 9, Philippine President Bongbong Marcos visited Japan to meet with Prime Minister Kishida Fumio.

French unions mobilize for new anti-government pension reform march

On Saturday (February 11), French trade unions again launched a nationwide mobilization against the government’s pension reform draft, calling on the people to take to the streets to express their opinions.
This is the fourth action day of the social movement against the government's pension reform draft.
How many people respond to the call for a strike may affect the next steps of the labor group.

This is the fourth time that the eight major trade unions in France have jointly mobilized the whole country in one month, and this is the first time that the protest has arranged the rally on Saturday.

Given that Saturday is a public holiday for most French people, who do not have to choose between participating in the demonstrations or going on strike, the unions hope that the rally will attract more people.

The unions of the public transport system, the subway and the public railway company did not call for a strike today, so the public transport system should operate normally, and citizens can take the bus to the rally site. In addition, in the areas where schools start winter vacation, people can go on vacation normally.

The trade union groups hope that more than one million people will participate in the rally today, while the police expect that the number of participants in the whole country may be between 600,000 and 800,000, and 90,000 to 120,000 people may gather in the Paris downtown area.

Although a poll shows that most French people do not support the proposal to postpone the legal retirement age from 62 to 64, the number of people who actually take to the streets to participate in the protest has been decreasing since the beginning of the anti-government pension reform movement.
The first strike demonstration on January 31 gathered 1.27 million to 2.5 million people across the country.
The number of protesters on Tuesday (February 7) has shrunk to between 770,000 and 2 million nationwide.
This pension reform is currently under discussion in the French National Assembly.
The opposition parties, especially the opposition party group led by the radical left, submitted countless amendments, which slowed down the deliberation process.
And the debate between the government and the opposition is becoming more and more intense.

A member of the radical left-wing party France Insoumise recently posted a picture of himself standing on a balloon with the image of the Minister of Labour on it on social media, which has caused the ruling party to protest.

The Speaker of the National Assembly finally announced that the member of parliament was banned from participating in the activities of the National Assembly for 15 days as a punishment for this behavior.
Despite fierce opposition from the mining industry, there hasn’t been any concessions so far.

The trade unions have already prepared to launch another action on Thursday, March 7, when the reform bill was submitted to the Senate for discussion, the trade unions also planned to organize a demonstration.

The conditions for sperm donors include being 165cm tall or above, having a college degree or above, or being a student, not having color blindness or color weakness, and not having genetic diseases such as B liver and infectious diseases.

According to the report, the Shaanxi Human Sperm Bank has a promotional poster that reads "Donating sperm for money is a great honor", and it calls on young people to respond to sperm donation and encourages netizens to forward related information, "to spread love".
The price in Shaanxi is higher than that in Yunnan. The qualified donors can get RMB 300 cash each time, and the donors who have completed a certain number of donations can get RMB 5,000 subsidy.

Former East German Communist Party leader dies
Hans Modrow (as Prime Minister of East Germany)
so we have lost an important leader.
On November 13, 1989, four days after the Berlin Wall was opened, which had separated East and West Berlin for 28 years, Mordow said he would help turn East Germany into a democratic country.
At the time, the Communist leaders were forced to resign as protesters across East Germany demanded democracy and freedom.
Gorbachev, who came to power in the Soviet Union, demanded reforms in the Soviet-dominated Eastern Europe.
On March 18, 1990, Modrow announced the first and only free elections in the history of the German Democratic Republic (GDR).
The election results caused him to no longer be the prime minister.
Despite the reforms, his opponents accused him of trying to delay the political changes and reunification that took place in October 1990.
He was also criticized for trying to rebrand the secret police rather than abolish it.
In 1993, Modrow was convicted of election fraud in the 1989 municipal elections, but did not go to jail.
The U.S. Justice Department denied the charges were politically motivated.
From 1990 to 1994, Modrow continued to serve in the German Parliament and was a Member of the European Parliament from 1999 to 2004.
Modrzejewski sees himself as a reformer and wants to change the party from within.
In 1999, he told Reuters he did not want the old East Germany back, but said it was important to recognize its achievements.
Modrow was born in Jasenitz, a small town in Germany in 1928, and trained as a mechanic.

During World War II, he was a lieutenant in the youth fire brigade and, as the war was drawing to a close, a member of the Volkssturm, a Nazi militia that recruited men aged 16 to 60 to fight in the final struggle.
At the age of 17, Modrow was captured by the Soviet army and taken to the Soviet Union as a prisoner of war, where he participated in anti-fascist courses and became a staunch communist.
In 1949, the year of the founding of the GDR, he returned to his homeland and found a job as a mechanic, continuing his studies in the social sciences and economics and earning a doctorate.

Moderow was a member of the Free German Youth, a movement to which almost all young people in East Germany belonged, and rose to become chairman of the party in the Dresden region between 1973 and 1989, when the Socialist Unity Party (SED) was in power.
Chairman Mao Zedong held this post for 33 years.
In 1990, Modrow became the de facto leader of East Germany, assuming the highest national office.

The Syrian Earthquake Relief Efforts

Since the devastating earthquake that struck Turkey and neighboring Syria, rescue teams from dozens of countries have worked around the clock in the rubble of thousands of collapsed buildings to save survivors buried under the debris.
They often called for silence in the cold, as they strained to hear any sign of life from the rubble of concrete.
According to the report of Reuters today, two women were rescued after surviving in the debris of the earthquake for several days.
But the death toll from the quake has risen to 24,150.
Turkey has 20,665 deaths, Syria more than 3,500.

The 7.8 magnitude quake that struck on Monday, followed by several strong aftershocks in Turkey and Syria, is the seventh deadliest natural disaster of the century, surpassing the 2011 earthquake and tsunami in Japan and coming close to the 31,000 deaths caused by an earthquake in neighboring Iran in 2003.
a 7.4 @-@ magnitude earthquake struck northwestern Turkey, killing more than 17,000 and injuring 44,000.
Two women have been rescued from the rubble of a collapsed building in Turkey 122 hours after a deadly earthquake struck the region, authorities said on Saturday.
Another injured man, 55, was identified as Masallah Cicek, who was rescued from the rubble of a collapsed building in Diyarbakr, the largest city in southeastern Turkey.
Rescuers often call for silence in the cold, as they strain to hear any sign of life amid the rubble of concrete.
In Samandag district in Turkey, rescue workers crouched under concrete slabs, whispering "Inshallah" - "God willing" - as they gingerly reached into the rubble to pull out a 10-day-old baby.
His eyes wide open, baby Yagiz Ulas was wrapped in a warm blanket and carried to a field hospital.
Video images showed paramedics carrying his mother, who was on a stretcher, dizzy and pale but alert.

Turkish Vice President Fuat Oktay told reporters late on the night of August 11 that 67 people had been rescued from the rubble in the past 24 hours, and that 31,000 people had been mobilized to the disaster area.
He said that about 80,000 people were being treated in hospitals, while 1.05 million people were homeless because of the earthquake and were crammed into temporary shelters.
As many people lack food in the cold winter conditions, the people are increasingly questioning the two leaders' response to the disaster.
Syrian President Bashar al-Assad and his wife Asma visited a hospital in Aleppo, the first time he has visited an area affected by the earthquake, according to state media.
Earlier this month, the World Food Programme said it was running out of food in the northwest of Syria, where the war has made it difficult to deliver aid.
On Friday, Erdogan visited the Adiyaman province in Turkey, where he acknowledged that the government's response had not been fast enough.
Opponents have seized on the issue to attack Erdogan, who is seeking re-election in a vote on May 14 but may have to delay it because of the disaster.
Reuters said that the anger caused by the delayed aid and the rescue work may affect the election.
even before the earthquake, the vote was seen as the most serious challenge to Erdogan's 20 years in power.
Erdogan called for unity and denounced what he called a "negative campaign for political interests."
Kemal Kılıçdaroğlu, the leader of the main opposition party, criticized the government’s response.
Critics said, "The earthquake was big, but what was worse than the earthquake was the lack of coordination, lack of planning and incompetence.

Hanoi - VNA special correspondent reports that on the morning of February 11, during his visit to Brunei Darussalam, Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh and his wife visited the University of Brunei Darussalam (UBD, also known as the University of Brunei).
Universiti Brunei Darussalam is the largest higher education and scientific research center in Brunei, and ranks third in the regional university rankings.
The University of Brunei Darussalam is one of the symbols of the Vietnam-Brunei cooperation in education and training.
The University of Brunei Darussalam officially established a cooperative relationship with the FPT University of Vietnam in July 2013. The main cooperation areas are English language training.
In addition to English, French, moral education, Japanese and Korean, the University of Brunei Darussalam also includes Vietnamese in its teaching curriculum.
During his visit to the University of Brunei Darussalam, Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh and his wife exchanged views with students in the Vietnamese language class.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh is delighted to see more and more foreigners are interested in learning Vietnamese, and he is willing to make positive contributions to promoting Vietnamese culture and people’s customs to the world.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh said that he believed and hoped that the Vietnamese language teaching staff of the University of Brunei Darussalam would become stronger and stronger; the students of the Vietnamese language class would be more and more interested in Vietnamese language, and make efforts to learn it, so that they could use Vietnamese fluently and become envoys of the friendly and cooperative relations between Vietnam and Brunei.

During this opportunity, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh also communicated with Vietnamese students studying English at the FPT-UBD Global Center in Da Nang via video conference to understand their learning situation, especially during the pandemic.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh said that the cooperation between Vietnam’s FPT University and Brunei’s University of Brunei Darussalam, especially the FPT-UBD Global Center, is a vivid symbol of the educational cooperation between Vietnam and Brunei.

At the same time, I hope that the students of this center can make greater progress in their studies and make positive contributions to the friendly and cooperative relations between Vietnam and Laos.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh highly appreciated the results of the cooperation between the two countries in the field of education, including the cooperation between FPT University and the University of Brunei Darussalam, as well as the University of Brunei Darussalam’s inclusion of Vietnamese language in its teaching curriculum.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh hopes that the University of Brunei Darussalam will continue to pay attention to ensuring the quality of Vietnamese language teaching and further expand the scale of Vietnamese language classes.

Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh also highly appreciated the positive results of the cooperation between the two countries on the basis of the Memorandum of Understanding on Education Cooperation signed in April 2014; and suggested that Brunei continue to provide more scholarships and effectively carry out various short-term exchange training projects such as the Global Discovery Programme and the Discovery Year.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh highly appreciated the establishment of the first branch of the University of Brunei Darussalam in Vietnam in Southeast Asia; believed that the university would grow in scale in the region and the world; and further expand its cooperation with Vietnamese universities.
At this opportunity, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh and his wife planted a memorial tree in the campus of the University of Brunei Darussalam and left a message in the memorial book.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh wished that the University of Brunei Darussalam would continue to develop and contribute more and more to the education sector of Brunei Darussalam, and also to deepen and broaden the cooperation with Vietnamese educational and training institutions.

Hanoi - VNA special correspondent reports that the official visit of Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh and his spouse to Singapore and Brunei has been a complete success and has yielded comprehensive, practical and concrete results.

Sultan Hassanal Bolkiah of Brunei and Premier Pham Minh Chinh are preparing to enter the bilateral talks.

What is the object that was shot down in the sky over Alaska?
and what a twist(ed) ending!
The US military shot down an unidentified object flying in the sky of Alaska with the most advanced stealth jet fighter F-22 on Friday afternoon (February 10).
The crash site is about 10 miles off the coast of Alaska.
This is the second time in less than a week that the US military has shot down an airborne object.
A Chinese spy balloon that had been drifting over the United States for days was shot down off the coast of South Carolina on Saturday.

The second object was first detected in U.S. airspace on Thursday night as it moved over northeastern Alaska, at an altitude of 12,000 meters (40,000 feet), and was about the size of a small car, much smaller than the Chinese spy balloon that was shot down earlier, the Pentagon said.
The Pentagon also said there was no indication that the object was maneuverable.

John Kirby, the White House National Security Council's strategic communications coordinator, said Friday that while the exact nature of the object is unclear, it "poses a reasonable threat to the safety of commercial aircraft."
Kobe said that this object was different from the espionage balloon found in the United States, and it did not hang "effective load".
"We call it a 'body' because that's the best description we can give it right now," Kobe said.
President Biden made the decision to shoot down the object after consulting with the Pentagon, and he did so "very carefully," Koby said.

The official description of this object by the US government is: it is about the size of a small car, without a control rod, without a suspension device, and flying at an altitude of about 10,000 meters.
But this information does not answer the basic questions, such as what this object is, which country it belongs to, and what mission it is on.
At present, many analyses and speculations on the Internet believe that this may be another Chinese balloon.
It may be like the spy balloon that invaded US airspace and the Chinese balloon that floated over Latin America, both of which were on a mission somewhere.
Some people also associate the object in Alaska with UFO.
“I wish this ‘UFO’ was a spy balloon and not a legitimate UFO,” said Peter Meijer, a former U.S. congressman, in a tweet on Friday, according to a report by Newsweek.
"It's a very amusing irony that you can mix up alien spacecraft with weather balloons, but it's not worth starting an interstellar war over," Maje says.
Majors tweeted this shortly after it was confirmed that the object in Alaska was shot down by the US military.
Newsweek said that Majer was not the only one who doubted that the object was a UFO.

Republican Congressman Tim Burchett of Tennessee criticized the government's cover-up of intelligence last month, and demanded that the Office of the Director of National Intelligence (ODNI) release reports on "unidentified flying objects".

In fact, The Locum Life is his fourth book.
The tone of this book is extremely plain, like plain water, and the words and sentences are extremely simple, and the plot is like a street in the afternoon in summer, quiet and plain.
Each has a start, a middle and an end, albeit never final.
Finally, they are gathered together and named "What We Talk About When We Talk About Love".

I think this novel collection and its title are like performance art. The author wants to express that love is not just the ups and downs on the stage, the legends of the city, nor the sticky sweet love between you and me. Love is not represented by the above, nor should it be represented by the above. Love is also the life of water, the dull day after day, the helplessness of life, the escape from reality, and the confusion of the future.
As you read this book, you may be thinking of the couples you know who are fighting, the marriages of people you know that are dull and unfulfilling, and the relationships that are not going well.

This is exactly why I don't recommend reading it, from an aesthetic point of view, the writing and plot are both dull, unless your life is full of drama or sweet as living in a candy castle, otherwise you will feel bored and indifferent when reading it.

And from a philosophical standpoint, the daily events don't offer any new insights or expand one's thoughts and horizons (unlike Marquez's Love in the Time of Cholera), and the brief scenes don't explore any issues, such as what kind of mistakes led to the failure of love?
Reason for marriage breakdown
So I don't recommend reading this book, whether you read it or not doesn't matter much.
The author's ideas are expressed more through techniques and genres than through plot, which is why the reading experience is not so good.
It is suitable for rough reading, but cannot be read in detail.
The logic of the book is good, but the content is not enough.
It explains a lot of sales theory, what it is and why, but it's very weak on how to do it, just pointing to the direction but not giving specific methods.
It felt like separate divided pieces, rather than a whole.
They come from the earth and, unlike canvas and oil, they give grudgingly.
It is not clear whether the stories are made up to illustrate the point, but if the author could give some examples of his own experience, it would be more convincing.
In the name of customers or customers, it is always changing.
The title is still customers, but the text becomes customers.
There are also problems such as typos, missing punctuation marks and wrong numbering in e-books.
In short, this book is a good choice for those who want to learn the theory of sales, but it is not suitable for those who are already engaged in sales and want to improve their sales skills.
A quick guide to internet finance

This book is shallow, and can be said to be only an introductory course, which can help everyone quickly understand the whole picture of Internet finance, but to understand it deeply, you still have to follow the clues and dig it yourself.

Moreover, the book was published at an early time, and the content of the Alipay WeChat loan subsidy war that cultivates user habits has not been mentioned yet. Nowadays, the proportion of third-party payment is probably not as small as that mentioned in the book.
Nowadays, many people go out to eat with their mobile phones. Merchants also give up the UnionPay card because of the high bank flow.

But I am still grateful to the author for writing this introductory book. It is obvious that the author has at least several years of financial observation experience, and is very familiar with the financial development history of both domestic and foreign countries. Therefore, he can write such easy-to-understand contents.
It is easy to write high and empty, but it is difficult to write in plain language.
I appreciate you, and I want you to know it!
The first factor that determines a person's job satisfaction is not the salary, but whether he or she is respected and appreciated in the workplace.
According to Maslow’s Hierarchy, humans are innately selfish and need to fulfill their basic needs.
Indeed, for the Chinese, most of them are “I love you but I can’t say it”. Even if they have love, gratitude and appreciation, they will keep it in their hearts and never say it out.
The five languages of appreciation in this book are: words of affirmation, quality time, receiving gifts, acts of service, and physical touch.

I think it's not important that you know what the five languages of appreciation are, but that you can use them to appreciate and thank the people around you, whether they are your family, friends or colleagues.
Actually, the closer the relationship, the more appreciation and gratitude is needed. Only in this way can our lives become more beautiful.
If companies learn to appreciate their employees, they can retain talent to some extent and reduce the resignation rate.
I would like to thank the translators for bringing us the wonderful ideas and the world from abroad.
Due to the cultural background of the East and the West, there will be some differences between languages. If you have the opportunity to see the original version of the author, you will gain more.
I would like to thank the authors, translators and editors for their hard work!

On the night of September 23, my wife's mobile phone was dropped. I suddenly decided to order an 8P from Lazada Malaysia on Amazon. There was stock, but it was not a self-operated store and there was no price increase (I was secretly happy). My wife is so upset because she has no mobile phone. She called me at 6:00 am the next day to ask me to think of a way. I went to JD.com and found that 256G could be delivered on the same day. I had to order another one.
I got a new one, so I wanted to cancel the Amazon order right away.

Since the order was placed at midnight, it is impossible to receive the express in the morning. At 7 o'clock, I called the customer service to cancel the order. The customer service replied that the order had been cancelled and asked me to wait for the text message.

Well, I just patiently waited, and when I checked my mobile phone in the middle of the day, the order was still in the status of not shipped, so I immediately contacted the customer service to ask them to cancel the order as soon as possible, and the customer service replied that they had already operated OK.

At 3 pm, I checked my order on my mobile phone and found that it was still there. I could only contact the customer service again to make it clear that I had called three times. Please cancel the order and notify the seller not to send the goods!
The customer service contacted the seller on my request and informed me that the seller was not familiar with the system and would cancel the order after familiarizing with the system.
But I was told by the seller that he knew it and would not ship it, so please rest assured.
I checked the order status on Monday and it was shipped. I was speechless.
Since I couldn't contact the seller directly, I had to call the customer service again.
The handling afterwards was ridiculous, basically I said a step and the customer service person would do it.
The order is still in the status of refused to be delivered, and is about to be re-sent!

The company has already received the money, so it doesn't matter if they don't follow up.
I'll never prepay for big items again, this is too much trouble.
